He faces challenges of limited capital, however, he has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning and owning a modern boutique. John intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
Araz is 40 years old, married, and has three children, an 11-year-old daughter and 15-year-old and 18-year-old sons. His daughter and sons go to school. He wants his daughter to become a geography teacher and his sons to go into business. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Araz has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now Araz lives in Fuzuli region which is close to the occupied border. He started his business three years ago, as a woodworker. He makes foot-lockers, shelves, etc. of wood. Now he needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy electric tools because his electric tools are spoiled and he can't work. He wants to use the money from his new business to help his family. In the future he wants to have his own workroom. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy electric tools

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle. He is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is educating his children and owning at least five motorcycles. He has been operating a retail shop and a motorcycle business for the last eight years despite challenges with high fuel costs. Amos intends to use the loan to buy stock of soap, charcoal and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of soap, charcoal and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 40-year-old married man with four children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He earns his living by selling maize, ice and beans. Like most farmers he faces the challenge of price fluctuations and bad weather. But he is determined to educate his children so that they can attain degrees. Richard intends to use this loan to buy a motorcycle and land to farm.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and land to farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old married man with 5 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop, along side farming as an additional income. He is facing hardships of price fluctuation and bad weather. However, he has a vision of owning a wholesale shop, since there are many retail shops in the area dealing in the same products. 

John intends to use the loan to buy more stock of sugar and soap, as well as land for farming.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and land for farming.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the densely populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single and she is a university student. She is an easy-going person, business-minded, and a hardworking woman. For the past four years she has been selling charcoal by the bag in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and continue her education.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina de 32 años de edad , está casada y tiene 2 hijas . Vive contenta rodeada de sus padres, hijos y esposo en la casa de sus padres. Desde los 20 años trabaja en las tierras de cultivo por está razón siembra papas, arvejas y habas. “Es rentable sembrar habas y arvejas porque no se invierte tanto como en la papa”, explica.Delfina afirma que el trabajo en el campo es muy cansado, más aún soportando las lluvias y el frío de su zona, pero estos no son inconvenientes para seguir luchando ya que sus hijas valen la pena .Las ventas son mejores en la capital del país, así que viaja con constancia llevando verduras y papas al mercado mayorista.
Ella espera contar con buenos ahorros para adquirir un auto y así trasladarse con facilidad, para ello seguirá trabajando con el mismo optimismo.
Éste sería su octavo crédito con KIVA y da su palabra de ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas mensuales.Delfina invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 32 years old, married, and has 2 daughters. She lives contentedly in her parent's house, surrounded by her parents, children, and husband. For 20 years, she has worked in cultivated fields and, for that reason, she grows potatoes, green peas, and beans. “It is profitable to sow beans and green peas because you don't have to invest as much as you do in potatoes,” she explains.

Delfina affirms that farm work is very tiring, and she has to put up with the rains and cold of her region. But such inconveniences do not stop her from continuing the struggle, because her daughters make it worthwhile. Sales are better in the national capital, therefore she travels there constantly, transporting vegetables and potatoes to the wholesale market.

Delfina hopes to be able to save a lot and acquire an automobile to facilitate her transport. And to do so, she will work with that same optimism.

This will be Delfina's 8th loan with Kiva and she gives her word that she will be punctual in making her monthly payments. Delfina will invest the 3,800 sols in purchasing organic manure to fertilize her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fima has a food vending business in the Philippines. Fima has been in this business for twelve years. Fima requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Fima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Please meet Alusine from Sierra Leone.  He is 34 years old and married with two children, aged 6 and 8.  Both of his children are currently attending school. 

Alusine owns a clothing and accessories business in Waterloo area.  When he was younger, he liked to assist his mother with the business and later also went into business himself.  He has been operating his own business for 10 years.  He works every day of the week from 7am to 7:30pm.  He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more bags, shoes, clothes, sandals and trousers.  In five years, he wants to expand and introduce other merchandise to his business.  He says his main challenge is transportation costs and increasing prices of some goods.  He is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes, clothes, sandals and trousers.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata from Waterloo, Sierra Leone.  She is 34 years old and married with one child, aged 12.  Her husband works two jobs, one as a pastor and one as a private security officer. 

Aminata has been running a provisions shop in town since 2011.  She started her business to help her husband take care of the family.  She works at her shop for 10 hours a day, from Monday to Sunday.  She wants to use the loan to buy more goods to sell, such as drinks, milk and mayonnaise.  She wants expand her shop and sell more goods to her customers.  She says that during the rainy season, business is difficult as there are fewer customers.  She is says thanks to BRAC and Kiva and is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as drinks, milk and mayonnaise

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is Salamata from Sierra Leone.  She is 48 years old and married with nine children.  Her youngest child is eight years old.  

Salamata owns a cookery in Waterloo, a suburb outside of the capital.  She initially started in business because her father was sick and she had to drop out of school to help the family.  She chose the food business because it has the most customers and is a profitable business.   She works from 7 am to 7 pm every day.  She is requesting the loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her restaurant, including rice, soft drinks, oil, sesame and tomatoes.  She hopes to see her business expand into a larger space and become more profitable.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her restaurant, including rice, soft drinks, oil, sesame and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en: Ibrahem is a 22-year-old single young man. He is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover all his needs. Ibrahem also is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ibrahem to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Ibrahem and improve his living conditions. Ibrahem is photographed in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet's school is running well. She was able to provide desks and chairs from the previous loan. As a result of the increased enrollment, she looks forward to supplying textbooks. 

She is therefore applying for a loan of 43,150 Kenya shillings to buy her school textbooks. Linet believes this will help put the school at par with some of the public schools in the area.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu is 37 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a plumber. They have a 13-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home. 

For the past thirteen years, she has been selling peanut and palm oil in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peanut and palm oil for her business. 

Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more peanut and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Aminata from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 8 and 16. Her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Aminata established her grocery business. She began her business because her mother trained her in business management. She works at the business every day from morning to night.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman who desires to educate her children, despite the low purchasing power of customers.  

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy milk, soft drinks, sardines, mayonnaise and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the lives of her family and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Aminata plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, soft drinks, sardines, mayonnaise and pure water.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis, a resident of Mombasa, Kenya, runs a second-hand textbook stall. He is single. The books are normally purchased by those who cannot afford the cost of new books. The business has been operating for two years.

Dennis was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to order another stock of books. His ambition is to complete his studies and he believes the income from this business will help him achieve that.

loans.use: to buy another stock of used textbooks.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a fifty year old lady. She is married to her husband, Joseph, and is a mother of one child. 

She sells beans in Nairobi city centre, She has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This will be Caroline's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase stock such as beans and green grams. In the future, she wants to sell different types of cereals.

loans.use: to purchase cereals such as beans and green grams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some traditional dresses (pagnes) for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Fatmata from Calabatown, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married and has two children between the ages of three months and five years.  She has four additional dependents that live with her at home. 

Fatmata runs a provision store. She sells milk, rice, soft drinks and cool water. She has been running this business for six years. She works at the business from 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day. She describes her major problems as insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation. 

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities such as milk, rice, soft drinks and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to renovate the roof of her house and increase her business. In the future, she plans to be a businesswoman. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food commodities such as milk, rice, soft drink and pure water.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan lives in Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married, has three children and owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for two years. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and joined so he could access credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and price fluctuations. Jonathan is applying for a loan for 83,500 Kenyan shillings to buy more items to sell, including soft drinks, sugar and flour. The extra income he earns from this loan will be added to his savings to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has 5 children ages 24, 22, 18, 16 and 13 years. In 1998, Rugiatu established her local foodstuffs business selling garie (cassava flakes) and palm oil. She began her business because she wants to help her husband to take care of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Rugiatu requires the loan in order to buy more local foodstuffs for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profit. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to build a house and improve on the business. She is very hardworking and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garie and palm oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 34 year old married woman. She has two children, ages three and six years old. 

Mary operates two businesses, a dairy farm and real estate venture. In these capacities, she sells milk and provides housing accommodations. She has been involved in these businesses for six years. She works in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Her biggest business challenge is that she has insufficient funds to improve her businesses. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy animal feed and pay for the renovation of her rental houses. Her business goal is to expand her businesses within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay for the renovation of rental houses

loans.name: Mowore

texts.en:
Mowore is 43 years old and lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single with two children ages 8 and 13, both of whom are attending school and live at home. 

For the past 5 years she has been running a restaurant in the local market. She makes more profit sometimes, but most of the time business goes slow. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business. 

Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 32 years old and a married mother of one child, age ten years. She runs a pharmacy in Waterloo, in the eastern area in Sierra Leone. Her child is currently attending school. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough to support the family.

She's been in this business for five years and sells injection medicine, blood tonics, and anti-malarial drugs. At present, her challenge is with price inflation.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more injection medicine, blood tonics, and anti-malarial drugs. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her child up to the university level and will improve her pharmacy. In the future, she would like to open a clinic, so she would help her community with health care. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more injection medicine, blood tonics, and anti-malarial drugs.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. She runs a cereals supply shop which has been in operation for ten years. She is also employed. Milka’s business also employs two other people.

Milka was introduced to Milango by her friends, and she is asking for a loan of 85,850 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals like millet, sorghum, and beans.

Despite the challenge of bad debts, Milka believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income to the other employees and also use part of the money to grow the business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To buy cereals like millet, sorghum, and beans.

loans.name: Abu-Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Abu-Bakarr. He is married and has three children, 18, 15, and 12 years old. 

In 2005, Abu-Bakarr established his rice and timber business. He began his business because he was not educated. His business is located in the outskirts and his main customers are general community people. Working seven days per week and 12 hours per day, Abu-Bakarr earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. 

Abu-Bakarr would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy more timber and rice for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to increase his profit. In the future, Abu-Bakarr plans to develop in business, build houses, and give quality education to his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice and timber for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Rebecca from Calaba town. She is divorced with two children, and she also takes care of two other relatives. To earn a living, Rebecca runs a bar and restaurant store. She sells snack food, soft drink, beer, stout and pure water. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m., six days per week.  

Rebecca says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run her business. Rebecca has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, beer, stout and pure water. The extra income resulting from this loan will allow her to take proper care of her family. In the future, she plans to become a drinks distributor. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, beer, stout and pure water.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman. She has owned a vegetable and fruit stand in the market for over two years. She depends on steady clients who visit her in the market daily to purchase her products. 

The loans that she obtained from Yehu Microfinance allowed her to obtain operating capital to purchase products on sale and in greater quantities. This was beneficial for her business because prices vary constantly.

Therefore, she is seeking a loan to purchase a freezer and merchandise, including tomatoes, onions, lettuce, oranges, and apples.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and merchandise, including tomatoes, onions, lettuce, oranges, and apples.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for one year. In this business, he sells retail stock like rice, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. 

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and price fluctuations. 

John is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, and other items. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve on the living standard of his family and also will be used to open a green grocery stall.

loans.use: To increase his stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat and related items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gari and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to rebuild her business by buying outfits for resale.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny lives in Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married businesswoman and has three school-going children. She owns a farming business and keeps poultry. This business has been running for three years. In addition to her poultry business, she works as a building contractor, a business which has been running for five years.

She learned about Milango through an employee, and she joined a group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is bad debts.

Winny is applying for a loan of 107,250 Kenyan shillings to renovate the poultry house, buy chicks, feed and drugs. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more stock. Her desire is also to keep layers in the near future and to establish a permanent poultry farm away from town.

loans.use: To renovate the poultry house, buy chicks, feed and drugs.

loans.name: Maria Ermelinda

texts.es:
María,solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y otros materiales para seguir en el negocio, elaborando los productos alimenticios que hasta ahora le permiten cubrir sus necesidades, quiere con el préstamo  comprar al por mayor la leña y el maíz, ya que tendrá mejor precio, su riesgo en el negocio es cuando vende al crédito y se le dificulta recuperar los pagos.
El credito anterior le permitio incrementar la productividad y las ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is asking for a new loan to buy corn, firewood and other materials. This will let her continue her business making food products, which until now has allowed her to meet her needs.

With this loan she wants to buy firewood and corn wholesale, because she will get a better price. The risk in her business is that when she sells on credit it can be difficult to recover payments.

Her last loan allowed her to increase her productivity and earnings.

loans.use: To buy wood and corn wholesale.

loans.name: Chitenderano Group

texts.en: This is 26-year-old Juliana from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Juliana runs a retail business selling clothes and electrical goods. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are high transportation costs. Juliana has requested a loan of $900 to buy more clothes and electrical goods for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's disposable income. In the future, Juliana plans to build her business to a competitive level.

loans.use: to buy clothes and electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 32 años de edad , está casada con Santos, quien es padre de su hijo Samir y del pequeño que viene en camino. Esta familia vive unida en la casa que dentro de poco terminará de construir.Olivia cuenta que, desde que tenía 15 años ya apoyaba a sus padres en el trabajo del campo. De esta manera aprendió sobre lo cansado y gratificante que son las cosechas. Al lado de su esposo empezarón a producir papas en distintas variedades, habas y arvejas , además confiesa que el cultivo de este tubérculo es muy cansado por eso contrata trabajadores a quienes paga al día por sus servicios. A la vez, se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda de coméstibles la cual instaló en la casa donde vive. Por ahora prefiere cuidar su negocio porque tiene 8 meses de embarazo. Posteriormente se reincorporará al trabajo de campo porque extraña llevar sus pocas ovejas a pastar mientras realiza la limpieza de sus cultivos.Sus objetivos son claros. Aumentar su producción para ahorrar más e implementar su bodega con mayor mercadería.Éste sería su segundo crédito con KIVA y da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Olivia, de recibir su apoyo financiero invertirá los S/.3000 soles en el pago a los trabajadores que terminarán la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Olivia is 32 years old and married to Santos, who is the father of her son Samir and of the little one who's on the way. This family lives together in their house, which is under construction and will be finished soon. 

Olivia says that she has supported her parents by working in the fields since she was 15 years old. In this way she learned how exhausting and gratifying the harvest is. Together with her spouse, they began to produce different varieties of potatoes, beans, and peas. She says that growing these tubers is very tiring, so they hire labourers whom they pay by the day for their work. 

At the same time, she takes care of her small grocery store, which she opened in the house where she lives. For now she prefers to look after her business because she is 8 months pregnant. Afterward she will get back into working in the fields because she misses taking her few sheep to graze while she tends her crops.

Her objectives are clear. To increase her production to save more and to stock her grocery store with more merchandise. This is her second loan with Kiva and she gives her word that she will be punctual with her monthly payments. When she gets this financial support, Olivia will use the 3000 soles to pay workers to finish the construction of her home.

loans.use: to pay workers to complete the construction of her home.

loans.name: Beaular Heights Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 27-year-old Queen from Mutare. She is married and has no children. Queen runs a retail business where she sells clothes and electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge she faces are high transport costs. Queen has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes and electrical gadgets for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy her own residential stand. In the future, Queen plans to have her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and electrical gadgets for resale

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали 52 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Шахритус в юго-западной части Тажикистана. Сын работает в сфере услуг. Его жена работает преподавателем в школе. Сам Сафарали в данный момент хочет начать новый бизнес. Он хочет заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота, так как это сегодня прибыльное дело и не требует тяжелой работы. К тому же климат и природа этого района балгоприятстсвует разведению скота. Таким образом Сафарали обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Safarali is 52 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He lives with his family in the Shahrituz area in the southwestern part of Tajikistan.  His son works in the services sphere.  His wife works as a teacher at a school.  Safarali would like to start a new business.  He would like to start buying and selling large horned livestock, because it is a profitable business right now and does not require hard labor.  In addition, the climate and nature in this area are good for raising livestock.  This way Safarali applied for a loan.  He is asking for a loan for the purchase and resale of livestock.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Adama. She is a widow and has four children aged 26, 20, 18 and 15. In 2002, Adama established her garri and palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to maintain her family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 Le every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 Le. Adama requires a loan in order to buy more garri and palm oil for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profits.

In the future, Adama plans to build a dwelling house and business stores. She is hard working, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Francess  A.

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Francess.  She is married and has two children, aged 25 and 18. 

In 2009, Francess established her drinks business. She began her business to assist her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are mixed. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. 

Francess would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase more drinks  for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profit. With the proceeds of the business, she is determined to open another outlet, becoming a supplier of drinks (wholesale) to other retailers.

 She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more drinks.

loans.name: Lina

texts.ru:
Лина – предприниматель из Белой Церкви. Она торгует детской и подростковой обувью на крупном местном рынке. У нее свои две торговые точки. Занимается этим бизнесом Лина уже 17 лет. Более того Лина сама воспитывает дочку, оплачивает ее обучение в хорошем вузе в Киеве. 
Лине потребовались дополнительные финансовые средства в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести дополнительную партию товара для реализации. За счет удачной реализации очередной партии товара Лина надеется иметь стабильный доход и развивать далее свой бизнес, обеспечивая свою семью.
texts.en:
Lina is an entrepreneur in Belaya Tserkov.  She sells children's and teenage shoes at a large area market.  She has two sales locations.  Lina has been in this business for 17 years.  In addition, Lina raises her daughter alone and pays for her education at a good college in Kiev.

Lina needs additional financial resources of 15,000 hryvnia in order to purchase an additional lot for sale.  Thanks to successfully selling the additional lot Lina hopes to have stable profits and to grow her business, providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional lot of products for sale

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one school-going child. He owns a transportation business which he has been operating for two years. This mode of transport (motorcycle) is greatly preferred because of the bad road network that is not accessible by regular vehicles.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transportation and fuel prices, seasonal weather, and finding customers.

Salim is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya Shillings to add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand his business. His dream is to see his business grow and buy another motorbike to boost his transportation business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a second car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 35 year old Mohamed who lives in Waterloo, Sierra Leone with his wife and two children, ages 1 and 5.  

Mohamed owns a spare parts business he started six years ago. He dropped out of school when his father had health problems and started his own business. He works at his business 20 hours per day, six days per week for the entire month. He will use the loan proceeds to buy more inventory such as engine oil, tires and brake fluid. He hopes to expand his business and become an importer of spare parts from Holland and become the wholesaler/distributor for all types of motor vehicle parts. He says that transporting stock from the purchasing site to the store is difficult. He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as engine oil, tires and brake fluid.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora casada de 49 años quien vive en Sololá. Actualmente tiene cuatro  hijos,  un varón quien trabaja con don Marcelo quien es su esposo apoyando  en el negocio y tres mujeres, una de ellas ya esta casada y las otras dos  estudian en una escuela de la comunidad.
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la producción de plantas de árboles forestales, esto lo aprendió cuando trabajo con el Estado en la reforestación de varias áreas de la región, ahora tiene 15 años de experiencia y de esta manera esta apoyando al medio ambiente, comercializando  arboles de la región de la cual obtiene ingresos aceptables.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,500.00 que utilizara el esposo para la compra de fertilizante orgánico y materiales para elaborar plantas de árboles forestales, ya que desea ofrecer más variedad de plantas a sus acreedores teniendo más y mejores ganancias.
Sueña con tener otra área para producir más plantas de árboles forestales, y así obtener mejores ingresos y proveerles a más organizaciones que aportan al medio ambiente.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Sololá. She has four children: one son, who is working with her husband, Marcelo, to help him with his business, and three daughters. One of her daughters is already married and the other two are studying at the local school.

Rosa and her husband make a living producing forest trees. She learned about this business when she was working with the government to reforest various areas of the region. She has fifteen years of experience and she is helping the environment by selling trees from the region, from which she is able to earn an acceptable income.

She has applied for a loan of 8,500 Guatemalan quetzals, which will help her husband to buy organic fertilizer and supplies to plant the forest trees, because she would like to offer a greater variety of plants to vendors, thereby earning a better income.

She dreams of having another area to produce more forest tree plants, in order to earn a higher income and to provide the trees to more organizations which contribute to the environment.

loans.use: to produce forest plants.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – фермер из с. Крынки. Он 10 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. Выращивает два урожая огурцов – ранние  и поздние – на 35 сотках земли. 
Сумму в 15 000 гривен Сергей планирует вложить в закупку семян, пленки и благоустройство теплиц, а полученную прибыль – в семью, чтобы восполнить возникающие нужды. По возможности Сергей хотел бы и дальше расширять свое хозяйство и заниматься любимым делом.
texts.en: Sergei is a farmer from Krinky village.  He has been in the greenhouse business for 10 years.  He grows two harvests of cucumbers - early and late - on 35 acres of land.  Sergei plans to invest the sum of 15,000 hryvnia in the purchase of seeds, film and to equip greenhouses, and use the profits for his family in order to fulfill upcoming needs.  If he is able, Sergei would like to further expand his holdings and continue running the business he loves.

loans.use: to buy seeds, film and equip greenhouses before the start of the season

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda, 54, is married and has four children ages 30, 28, 25 and 20. In 2007, Finda established her local foodstuff (garri and palm oil) business. She began her business because she wants to help sponsor her children's education. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are general community people. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Finda requires a loan to buy more garri and palm oil for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profit. In the future, Finda plans to build a dwelling house and business stores. She is very hard working and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more of her local foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for two years. She also has a rental house and obtains additional income through her spouse’s employment. Flora employs two other people in the business.
Flora was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables, sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.
Despite the high level of bad debts, Flora believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children and provide income to the other employees.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Smith

texts.en:
Smith is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has two children. Smith owns rental houses; the investment has been running for ten years. She learned of Milango Financial Services from an employee and joined the organization to get credit for business operations.

Smith is applying for a loan of KES 36,650 (Kenya shillings) to buy paint and cement for house repairs. The only challenge in the current business is when some customers do not pay their rent on time. Smith looks forward to overcoming this by diversifying into other forms of businesses in the future. The increased and stable income from this loan will help in paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy paint and cement for rental house repairs.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Pedro de 51 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Itagüí, Colombia. Debido a la carencia de educación tomó la decisión de subemplearse para generar ingresos y poder satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. Desde hace 15 años labora recorriendo las calles de la localidad vendiendo tinto, cigarrillo y parva a los transeúntes. Por medio de su actividad genera lo necesario para su alimentación y gastos personales.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su condición económica y calidad de vida ya que manifiesta que una de sus mayores dificultades es la inestabilidad en sus ingresos, por que existen factores como la lluvia que determinan su salario diario. Hoy ase encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de termos y café para aumentar su producción y generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Pedro, 51, lives in the municipality of Itagüí, Colombia. Due to his lack of education, he decided to work part-time to earn an income and satisfy his basic needs. For fifteen years, he has worked running around the city streets to sell coffee, cigarettes, and baked goods to pedestrians. With this business activity, he earns the income that is necessary for his food and personal expenses. 

His greatest dream is to be able to improve his financial conditions and quality of life, because one of his greatest difficulties is the instability in his income due to factors such as rain that determine his daily salary. He is applying for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of thermoses and coffee to increase his production and earn a greater income.

loans.use: to buy thermoses and coffee.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 25 years old, married and the mother of two school-going children. For the past six years she has run a local mobile money transfer service known as M-PESA in Kabarnet. She earns an average monthly income of 20,000 KES.
 
Vivian is applying for a loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD to pay for an M-PESA float for her business. She anticipates greater profits, which she will use to offer more services to her clients.

Vivian hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. Her ambition is to save enough money to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business into other towns.

loans.use: to pay for an M-PESA float.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Theresa.  She is married and has 3 children aged 24, 22, and 18 years. In 1999, Theresa established her drink-selling business. She began her business because she wanted to become self-employed. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Theresa requires a loan in order to buy more drinks. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profit. In the future, Theresa plans to become a wholesaler and distributor. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 57 years old and married to Philomena, who contributes to the family income. He has been a cobbler for a period of about 13 years, with an income of KES. 10,500 a month.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans. He wants to use the loan to buy shoe polish, laces, brushes, and leather dye. 

He hopes to have a fully dependable business that will support his family fully and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy shoe polish, laces, brushes, and leather dye.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a lady of 44 years, married to Peter, and a mother of three children.  She owns rental houses, a salon, and also a boutique. She has been in this business for seven years now and earns a monthly income of KES. 50,000.

This will be Catherine's first loan with KADET LTD . She plans to use the entire loan to buy building materials like sand and cement to finish plastering some of her rentals houses. In the future, she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand for plastering  her rental houses.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Salamatu.  She is married, and has 3 children ages 21, 18 and 16.  Two are attending school. She has 2 additional foster dependents, who live with her.  In 2010, Salamatu established her pure drinking water and soft drinks business. She began her business because she dropped out of school and got married.  Then her husband introduced her to business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,585,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase pure drinking water and soft drinks. In the future, Salamatu plans to build another house, educate her children and diversify the business.  This loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans. Inadequate capital and sometimes shortage of stock are her major challenges.  She is a hardworking business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase pure drinking water and soft drinks

loans.name: Kargoe

texts.en:
Kargoe is 43 years old and lives at New Kru Town in Montserrado County. He is married and a high school graduate. His wife  is a businesswoman, they have two children, ages  2 and 7,  who are presently attending school. For the past four years he has been running a general shop where he sells items like toothpaste, rice, sugar, soap, batteries, flour, etc. in his community,  He makes a lot of profit since he is the only one who is involved in that business in his community. Some of the problems he is facing are: he has not much income and transportation cost is very high.

Kargoe is requesting a loan to purchase more toothpaste, rice, sugar, soap, batteries, flour, etc. to add to his inventory. He plans to build a house for his children in years to come and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, rice, sugar, soap, batteries, flour, etc. to add to his inventory,

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married businessman and runs a construction supply shop. The business has been in operation for one year. He mainly supplies ballast and sand. He began through quarrying and by use of a hoe. He then obtained capital to buy and sell building stone.

Stephen was introduced to Milango Financial Services by an employee and is applying for a loan of KES 31,450 (Kenya shillings) to purchase a motorcycle, which he will deploy in the area for public transport. Stephen looks forward to studying some accounting courses and to be able to apply the same knowledge in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for public transport.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana, de 41 años de edad , está casada y tiene 2 hijos a los cuales cuida en la casa rústica que compró hace algunos años. Sebastiana se dedica a la agricultura y lleva 18 años sembrando alverja y papa en todas sus variedades, los cuales cuida con mucho amor , además se dedica a la  ganadería con el cuidado de sus 4 vacas a la que cuida con principal atención ya que son su principal fuente de ingreso. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una mina de Talco, donde gana una buena suma de dinero, pero hace poco sufrió una enfermedad producto de los químicos al que se expone. Por ello, Sebastiana, desea abrir una pequeña bodega de productos de primera necesidad, donde puede tener más ingresos y así mantener a su esposo junto a su familia.
Éste sería su tercer crédito con KIVA. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.Sebastiana invertirá los S/.100O soles en la compra de comida balanceada para nutrir a sus vacas.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 41 years old, married, and has two children she raises in a rustic home she purchases a few years ago. Sebastiana works in agriculture and for 18 years she has farmed a all varieties of peas and potatoes, which she cares for with great love. In addition, she raises four cows, which she looks after with utmost care as they are her primary source of income. She gets help from her husband who works in a talc mine, where he earns a good sum of money, but he recently suffered an illness as a result of the chemicals to which he is exposed. For this reason, Sebastiana hopes to open a small bodega selling staples where she can earn extra income and keep her husband together with the family.

This is her third loan with Kiva. She gives her word that she will be punctual in the making monthly payments. Sebastiana will invest the S/1000 soles in purchasing balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Miguel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Cordero para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miguel trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cama, la cual le servirá de mucho, ya que actualmente él y su hermano menor comparten la misma cama, de esta manera Miguel podrá brindar mayor bienestar y seguridad para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 22-year-old man who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He is a responsible, friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dreams of excelling. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Miguel had to start working at an early age in order to help his parents. He wasn't able to study Systems Engineering like he had hoped to do. 

In his free time, Miguel likes to play soccer with his friends and, on special occasions, cook the delicious Seco de Cordero (a typical Peruvian dish) to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Miguel has made a living thus far as a taxi driver, working in his home city. He works 12-hour days and believes his work has been successful so far because he is very responsible and knows where in the city to find the most passengers. 

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help him to buy a bed, which will be very helpful because he currently shares one with his younger brother. This loan will help Miguel to provide for his family. He will continue to work hard in order to reach his dream of one day becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy a bed.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Christiana.  She is divorced and has one child, two years old. 

In 2002, Christiana established her lady's fashion boutique business. She began her business because she wanted to take good care of her family. Her business is located on the outskirts of the city and her main customers are general community people. Working seven days per week and 12 hours per day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Christiana would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Christiana requires a loan in order to buy more fashion goods for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her, to increase her profit. In the future, Christiana plans to open more boutiques in different areas. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tania Wendy

texts.es:
Tania es una mujer de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante junto con sus pequeños; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Tania no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional, pero gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de Costura.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Tania trabaja brindando servicios de costura y confección de prendas de vestir, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Tania se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar madera y cemento a fin de hacer refacciones en las partes deterioradas de su hogar, de esta manera Tania podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Tania is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her children in the city of Pucallpa. She loves her children very much and they are her biggest motivation in life. Tania is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who dedicates all of her strength to helping her family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship and the need to work, Tania was not able to study for a professional career. However, thanks to her hard work, she was able to study sewing.

By her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Tania makes a living repairing and making garments. She works 10-hour days each day and believes that her success so far is due to the quality of her work and the kind way she treats her customers. Tania is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help her to improve her home. She needs to buy wood and cement in order to repair some deteriorating parts of her house. This will keep her family safer and healthier. Tania will continue to work hard to reach her dream of owning her own sewing shop.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in the Mombasa area. Her ambition for growth has helped her to achieve much through Milango Financial Services. Besides the add-on loans, she has been investing in farming. 

As the rainy season approaches, Juliet is asking for a loan of KES 112,600 (Kenya shillings) to buy chicks, feed, and medicines. This will go towards her poultry farm and crop farming and she is not hesitant to invest in bee-keeping. Juliet believes this will be a good venture and source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa  dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven para trabajar, Carlos no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresa que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja en un grifo de su ciudad, brindando atención al público, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir, como polos, pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder iniciar su negocio de venta ropa, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 32-year-old man who lives with his wife and kids in the city of Pucallpa. He loves his family very much and they are his biggest motivation in life. Carlos is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate themselves entirely to helping their family move forward. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Carlos had to begin working at a young age and was not able to study Business Administration like he hoped to do. 

In his free time, Carlos likes to cook the delicious Arroz con Pollo (a typical Peruvian dish with chicken and rice) to share with his family. By his own initiative and with much dedication and determination, he works in gas station, serving the public. He works 10-hour days and believes that he has been successful thanks to the kind way he treats customers. 

Carlos is grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help him to buy clothing such as polos, pants, shirts, blouses, and other items to stock the clothing shop he will open. In this way, he will continue working hard to achieve his dream of owning his own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing).

loans.name: Marta Margarita

texts.es:
Marta tiene 49 años de edad, es divorciada hace cinco años y tiene una hija de 25 años de edad. Vive alquilando en casa de un familiar. Se dedica al comercio de frutas desde hace quince años, en la orilla de una acera que esta enfrente de un parque. La fruta la compra en una ciudad que esta a 21 kilómetros de su casa, las adquiere ahí por uqe le dan un mejor precio y mayor variedad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más fruta y surtida para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Debido a los pocos recursos con los que dispone no puede comprar más fruta, y con el préstamo podrá comprarla  a tiempo. Su sueño, es instalar una tienda en su casa con productos básicos, viajar a estados unidos para conocer y que su hija se gradúe de la universidad
texts.en:
Marta is 49 yeas old. She has been divorced for five years and has a 25-year-old daughter. Marta rents her house from a relative. She has made a living selling fruits on the sidewalk in front of a park for the last 15 years. Marta buys fruit in a city 21 km away from her house because there she finds a better variety and better prices. 

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy more fruit and ingredients to meet the demand of her customers. Without this loan, Marta would not be able to gather together enough money to buy all the fruit she needs on time. 

Her dreams include opening a small store out of her home, visiting the United States on a vacation, and seeing her daughter graduate from a university.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and supplies to meet the demand from her customers.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has two children, aged 16 and 10 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her as assistants.  

In 2008, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to help her family. Her business is located on the outskirts and her main customers are general community people. Working seven days per week and 11 hours per day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase wax-cotton ladies' bags, etc. for resale. In the future, Fatmata plans to become an international businesswoman and provide quality education to her children. She is tall and fair in complexion. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ladies' bags, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo es un señor casado de 49 años quien vive en Sololá. Actualmente tiene cuatro  hijos,  un varón quien trabaja con don Marcelo quien es su papá apoyando en el negocio y tres mujeres, una de ellas ya esta casada y las otras dos  estudian en una escuela de la comunidad.
El se dedica a la producción de plantas de árboles forestales, esto lo aprendió cuando trabajo con el Estado en la reforestación de varias áreas de la región, ahora tiene 15 años de experiencia y de esta manera esta apoyando al medio ambiente, comercializando  arboles de la región de la cual obtiene ingresos aceptables.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,500.00 que utilizara para la compra de fertilizante orgánico y materiales para elaborar plantas de árboles forestales, ya que desea ofrecer más variedad de plantas a sus acreedores teniendo más y mejores ganancias.
Sueña con tener otra área para producir más plantas de árboles forestales, y así obtener mejores ingresos y proveerles a más organizaciones que aportan al medio ambiente.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a 49-year-old, married man with four children. He lives in Sololá. Marcleo works alongside his only son. One of Marcelo's daughters is married, and the other two study in a nearby school. Marcelo makes a living growing trees, a trade he learned while working for government reforestation projects in various regions of the country. He has 15 years of experience in this business. In this way, he helps to improve the environment, selling trees in regions where they go for the best prices. 

Marcelo is requesting a loan of 8,500 Guatemalan quetzales in order to buy organic fertilizer and other materials to help grow trees. He wants to offer his customers a better variety of plants in hopes of increasing his profits. One of Marcelo's dreams is to obtain another plot of land on which to grow trees, in order to increase his sales and provide trees for more organizations that help the environment.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and other materials to help grow trees.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a farming business. She keeps poultry and the business has been running for four years. Cecilia has two school-going children.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is poultry diseases. 

Cecilia is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to renovate the tap area and buy more chickens for sale. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more stock. Her desire is also to keep layers in the near future.

loans.use: To renovate the tap area and buy more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years old and married to Julius, who also contributes to the family income. She has been running her grocery shop for about two years now with an income of KES 14,000 a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD, and she wants to use the loan to buy assorted vegetables and potatoes for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to renovate her business structure.

She hopes to give her children quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adhiambo

texts.en:
Adhiambo is 59 years old mother from Migori County. She is making bricks for construction a business she has been doing for the last four years, and she makes a monthly income of KES. 15,000. 

She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy firewood and water for making bricks. 

She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business. She has a dream of leaving good legacy for her children.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and water for making bricks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 61 years old, and blessed with five children. Two of them are over 18 years old and the younger ones are; 16, 13 and three years old respectively.

Pauline is a small scale farmer, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. Pauline is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase farm inputs and pay laborers. She will use her anticipated profit to grow the business.

She has a dream of becoming a stable farmer in the region.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pay laborers

loans.name: Kubatana Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Lita from Harare. She is married with four children; two attend school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Lita runs a poultry project and sells chickens; she has been in business for three years. She says the main challenge is the chicks are affected by cold weather in the winter, and most of the chicks die. 

Lita has requested a loan of $500 to buy more chicks and chicken feed. She says the extra income generated from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Lita plans to supply major shops with chickens.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene's business has been experiencing great progress. She began the business through hawking, then purchased a motorcycle which has been earning her some income. She intends to increase the business and its outreach, to supply sanitary pads and clothes to the residents of the rural areas.

She is applying for a loan of KES 75,150 to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is grateful to all the lenders who supported her with the first loan. The business has experienced much growth over time, and she now supplies the groceries to other retailers and to direct, retail customers.

Martha is applying for a loan of 85,850 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices, to resell. She believes she has learned a lot over time in the business and will obtain income to meet her needs and repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of foodstuff to resell, such as tomatoes, onions and kale.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Joan works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from soft drinks retailing. Joan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy frozen food and soft drinks to sell to customers.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen food and soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Edelmiro Manuel

texts.es:
Edelmiro es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Edelmiro no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Edelmiro trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Edelmiro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para hacer el tarrajeo y puesta de piso de concreto en su hogar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edelmiro is a 32 year old man who lives in the city of Camaná.  He is very friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong desire to succeed.  Regrettably, due to a lack of financial resources, he had to begin working when he was very young and Edelmiro was unable to study for a professional career although he would have liked to do so very much.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends.

By his own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Edelmiro works as a laborer on an estate farm in his city.  He works every day for about ten hours and feels that it is going well because of his good performance and the kind treatment he provides to others.
  
Edlemiro is very grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the support provided, he will be able to improve his home.  He wishes to purchase building materials for cementing and installing concrete floors in his home.  In this way, he will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of being able to get ahead in life.

loans.use: make home improvements.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 29 years old and married. For the last three years he has earned a living by selling gasoline to the residents of Malindi. He earns 43,600 KES monthly.

Michael was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer. He repaid an initial loan and is now applying for a second of 20,000 KES to buy more gasoline to sell to his customers. He plans to use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his nephew's school fees as well as expand his business. 

Michael’s ambition is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lydia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ma. Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a shell-crafting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bamboo and nipa (palm leaves). Ma. Lydia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy nylon, shells and other materials for her shell-crafting business.

Ma. Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy nylon, shells and other materials for her shell-crafting business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, a 51-year-old married mother of seven, works hard to provide for her family. For 31 years she has been selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling bananas and firewood.

Anita, who has borrowed and repaid 7 previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 25000 to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has one child, aged 16. She has three additional dependents, who live with her and serve as her sales assistants in the business. In 2007, Fatmata established her textiles business. She began her business to empower and enable her to care for her child; she was a widow at that time. Her business is located at the heart of the city, and her customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 430,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and she has been making timely payments on her third loan.  Now she requires a new loan, in order to purchase additional business inventory. She hopes that this loan will enable her to generate more income for domestic use. In the future, Fatmata plans to further increase her stock level, to build a house, and to educate her child. She is saying thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for her business.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 58 years old, widowed, and has seven children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Trinidad has been raising pigs for five years, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain that activity.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams:  to renovate her family home and send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is 51 years old and married with three children.

Rechie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy groceries to sell at her store.

Rechie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rechie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 27 years old, married and has one child who is in school. 

Mary Joy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Mary Joy has been pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 50 years old and married with six children.

Alona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, spices, canned goods, soap, etc.

Alona has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Alona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, egg, spices, canned goods, soap, etc.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Melinda works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending and a general store. 

Melinda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her ready-to-wear business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her ready-to-wear business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, eggs, spices, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, eggs, spices, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 54 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 02 hijos los cuales son mayores e independientes, actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo .El trabajo de Carmen consiste en la venta de ropa y cométicos por catálogos, este trabajo lo realiza hace 11 años, vende en su casa y trabaja sola, cuando no hay muchos clientes durante el día sale a vender sus productos por la calle entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, además en algunas ocasiones se va a otras localidades en donde intercambia sus productos por otros ya que posteriormente los vende en los mercados de su localidad. Ahora quiere incursionar en la venta de abarrotes ya que en su zona no hay ninguna tienda y ha visto la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos.A Carmen le encanta su trabajo, le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, su alegría y picardía le permite atraer clientes continuamente, en el futuro desea establecer una tienda mucho mas grande en donde ofresca gran diversidad de productos.Este es el préstamo número 05 con KIva y se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio , por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas .
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 soles comprará ropa para niños y adultos así como tambien productos coméstibles tales como arroz, azúcar, harina, entre otros; para vender en su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54, is married and has two children who are independent adults.  Currently she lives in her own house with her husband.

Carmen's job is selling clothing and cosmetics via catalogue.  She has done this work for 11 years.  She sells in her house and works alone.  When she doesn't have a lot of customers during the day, she goes out to sell her products in the street among her friends, neighbors, and family members.  Sometimes she also goes to other towns where she exchanges her products for other ones that she later sells in her town markets.  Now she wants to get into selling groceries because there's no store in her area and she has seen the possibility of improving her income.

Carmen loves her job and she likes to have contact with people.  Her happiness and mischievousness allow her to constantly attract customers.  She wants to set up a much bigger store in the future where she'll sell a wide variety of products.

This is her fifth loan with Kiva.  She's happy to know that she'll have access to a line of credit to get ahead with her business.  This is why she pledges to make her payments responsibly.

With the requested amount of 2000 soles [PEN] she'll buy clothing for children and adults as well as food products to sell in her house, including rice, sugar, flour, and others.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults as well as food

loans.name: Lily Marcela

texts.es:
Lily es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Lily no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta viajar con su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lily trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y alquiler de vestidos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lily se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de vestidos de temporada, de esta manera podrá abastecer su negocio y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Lily seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr un gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lily is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Camana with her young son, whom she loves and who is her principal purpose in life. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who puts all her effort into providing the best for her son, since she is both father and mother to him.

Unfortunately, because of limited economic resources and because she had to work from a young age, Lily could not study a professional career. In her free time she likes to travel with her little one and sometimes she cooks a delicious fried fish to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Lily works in a small business selling and renting dresses. She works every day for about 10 hours and believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and because of the kind treatment she gives to clients.
