Lily is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the offered help she will be able to make a larger purchase of in-season dresses, and in this manner she will be able to supply her business and attend to more customers. Thus Lily will continue working and making an effort to achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy dresses for her store

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 38 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is five and the youngest is two. Her husband fixes bicycles. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more bicycle spare parts for sale. She plans to put the profit toward her savings.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 43 years old. He is married with no children; his wife is a farmer. He has been in business for five years. Jean Bosco has asked for a loan to buy more timber to sell. With the additional profit from this, he will finish up his own house and then put some money in savings.

loans.use: to buy more timber for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloths (hand towels, tablecloths, sheets)

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 29 years, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

Nelita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zorigtkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Zorigtkhuu, 49 years old, lives with his family in Kherlen district, Mongolia. The family resides in their own house, on a plot of land. He has been working as a sentry at a private business entity since 2005. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. So, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT. He will use the loan to purchase insulation and building materials, such as fiberglass, foam, bricks and cement.

As a result of the renovations financed with this loan, the family will live in a warm and comfortable place, and more importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and building materials, such as fiberglass, foam and bricks

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie works hard to support her family. Annalie is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Annalie requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Annalie has been in this business for four years now. In the future, Annalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 51 years old and married, with four children. With children in school, Aurora works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, soap, and shampoo.

Aurora has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora 2  está en su ciclo 4 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
Aidee es decoradora de todo tipo de eventos, se hizo conocida con sus propios clientes que le hacen publicidad, ya que es muy buena en lo que hace, gracias a su trabajo da a su familia lo que necesitan y que no les falte nada.
Aidee está solicitando de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de telas para poder mejorar su trabajo y seguir dando buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Maria Auxiliadora 2” Communal Bank is in its fourth cycle of the foundation’s women entrepreneurs program.  All of the members are engaged in activities to raise funds, and help each other to reach common goals that they all have within the group.  

Aidee is a decorator for all types of events.  She became known with her own customers and they do her advertising because she is very good at what she does.  Thanks to her work, she provides her family with everything they need and they don’t lack anything.  Aidee is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fabric in order to improve her work and continue providing her customers with good service.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to use for decoration at events.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité Sagrada Familia empieza el primer ciclo. Cada integrante cuenta con actividades económicas diferentes. Son señoras muy trabajadoras en la comunidad. Las señoras se mostraron muy contentas de recibir este programa en la comunidad, ya que les será de gran ayuda.
Ramona es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una pequeña despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene bien surtido su negocio, también la ayuda que Ramona es muy amable siempre.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, carnes, embutidos y demás, para poder seguir con sus ventas y dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Sagrada Familia Communal Bank is beginning its first loan cycle.  Each member has a different job.  They are very hardworking in the community.  The women seemed to be very happy to have this program in the community because it will be a big help to them.

Ramona's one of the members of this group.  She earns a living in sales.  She has a small grocery store where she works every day from a very early hour.  She says she has very good customers because her business is always well stocked.

She's requesting this loan to invest in buying fruits, vegetables, meat, cold cuts, and other products so she can continue with her sales and giving her customers what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, meat, cold cuts, and other products

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
El Señor Magno es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene casa propia, también tiene hijos, y cuenta que su esposa es comerciante.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, empezó a trabajar en una carpintería como ayudante y más adelante como encargado, su sueño de siempre era de tener su propio negocio y trabajar en forma independiente, generar más ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Con el correr del tiempos empezó a vender muebles en su propio local y por toda la zona, consiguió muchos clientes amplió mas su local y formo una despensa bien surtida, aumento su clientela y sus ventas diarias.
Magno solicita de este crédito para poder surtir la despensa con insumos de primera necesidad, como ser fideos, arroz, verduras, carne, y demás insumos, ya que estos lo ayudaran a seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Magno is from the city of Santaní.  He has his own house.  He also has children, and he says his wife is a merchant.

He's a very hardworking, responsible, and honest man.  He started working in a furniture shop as an assistant, and later as a manager.  His dream always was to have his own business and work independently to generate more income to improve his family's quality of life.

As time went by he began to sell furniture in his own store and throughout the area.  He acquired a lot of customers, expanded his store more and started a well-stocked grocery store, and expanded his clientele and his daily sales.

Magno's requesting this loan to be able to stock his store with necessity items such as noodles, rice, vegetables, meat, and other supplies, because this will help him continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, vegetables, meat, and other supplies

loans.name: Joelina

texts.en:
Joelina is 48 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Joelina requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy stock to resell at her store, like cream, coffee, milk, canned goods and spices.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell, like cream, coffee, milk, canned goods and spices

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business, raising pigs for sale in the local community, to earn a living. She has been in business for over six years and earns 1,500 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. Now she has applied for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy feed for her pigs. She hopes and dreams of having a better future and improving her living situation.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 62 years old, married, and has one child. Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks, including noodles, candies, canned goods and bread, to sell in her general store. Letecia has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and she also earns additional income from direct selling of Natasha (clothing) products. Letecia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, including noodles, candies, canned goods and bread, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy works hard to support her family. Joy is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Joy applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, including canned goods, biscuits, soap, milk and spices. Joy has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, including canned goods, biscuits, soap, milk and spices.

loans.name: Boy Jose

texts.en:
Boy Jose is 37 years old and single. He lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a fishing business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over five years and earns 10,000 PHP every month.

He has been associated with GDMPC since 2010. Now, he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fishing tools, such as hooks and nets. His hope and dream is to save money from his business, for use in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing tools, such as hooks and nets

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years, and she also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional stock to sell in her store, like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, and spices. Melania has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Melania aspires to save enough so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her store, like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar and spices

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene works hard to support her family by selling fish in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 29,500 from NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years, and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 3 bags of onions, 5 bags of dried okra, 2 bags of cabbages and soumbala (fermented néré seeds).

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is single and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Marilou has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Marilou has been in this business for one year. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. She earns a living from a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lilia has been in the pig fattening business for four years, and she also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Mr. Baljinnyam, 26 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable, felt dwelling) on fenced land. His wife has recently taken her maternity leave and now stays at home. Before maternity leave, his wife worked as a geologist at the same company where Baljinnyam works. He also is a professional geologist and has been working for two consecutive years.

The family needs an automobile for their daily transportation. So, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. The advantages of a natural gas vehicle are:  its emissions are cleaner, with lower amounts of carbon and lower particulates  per equivalent distance traveled. Also it wastes fuel less, compared to a of gasoline- or diesel-powered vehicle. Purchasing a natural gas vehicle is environmentally friendly and economically efficient for the borrower. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas-powered vehicle

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gaudiosa works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from firewood-vending.  Gaudiosa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Gaudiosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, where she owns and operates a farm. She has been in business for over six years and earns PHP 22,000 a month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizer. Her dream for the future is to provide a good life to her children and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 57 years old, married and has five children. 

Leonora is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been in pig fattening business for three years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.  Loreta has been in this business for 5 years; she earns additional income from a general store.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Tuzigame Group

texts.fr:
M. Rose fait partie du groupe Tuzigame et   habite à Kayanza. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Nestor, un commercant. Ensemble ils ont   4 enfants âgés de  3  à  9 ans, dont 3  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis 16 ans. 

Elle  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter une maison  pour ses enfants et les voir étudier
texts.en:
Rose is a member of Tuzigame Group and lives in Kayanza. She's 32 years old and married to Nestor, a reseller. Together, they have four children, aged 3 to 9. Out of them, three attend school.

Rose has been selling clothing for 16 years. This is her fifth loan with Kiva's partner, Turame. With this loan, she will bolster her working capital and buy a large quantity of clothing to resell, in order to increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to buy a house for her children and see them go to school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothing.

loans.name: Gantsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Gantsogt, 25 years old, lives with his girl friend in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple lives separately from their parents in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). His father has been driving a bus around the city since 2011.

Gantsogt has been working as a steward at a business entity since 2009.  He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. The advantages of a natural gas vehicle are its emissions are cleaner, with lower emissions of carbon and lower particulate emissions per equivalent distance traveled. Also it wastes fuel less compared to that of a gasoline or diesel-powered vehicle. Purchasing a natural gas vehicle is environmentally friendly, and economically efficient for the borrower. 

The borrower is very hardworking young adult who wants to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas vehicle.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: As the married parent of seven children, Merlinda works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling food in the Philippines, and earns additional income by farming vegetables and running a general store. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices and vegetables for her food-vending business. Merlinda has successfully paid back 14 previous loans and will use this new one to continue building up her food-vending business. Her goal is to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 46 years old, married with three children. She lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental; she owns and operates a snack food-selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years, and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She started working with GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as juice and bread. 

Her hopes and dreams are to improve her family's living situation, and to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as juice and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell (goods, snacks, drinks)

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. She is widowed and has four children. 

To make a living, Marianita owns and operates a business selling slippers and shoes. She has been in this business for 21 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month. Marianita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase new items so she can expand the range of goods that she sells. 

In 2008, Marianita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items so she can expand the range of goods that she sells.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional meat to sell in her butcher shop business.

Aida has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport and pig-fattening.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Khishigbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Khishigbayar, 39 years old, lives with her family in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as an operator at a carpet factory for eighteen consecutive years. 

Four years ago, Khishigbayar and her husband built their house with clay and planks and since that time, the house has not gotten any repair. So, she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase bricks for exterior siding. As a result, the house will preserve heat effectively and the family will burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. 

Khishigbayar is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase bricks in large quantity for exterior siding.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Nancy.  She is married and has three children, aged 26, 19 and 17. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her for proper care.  

In 1998, Nancy established her cosmetics, suitcases, Coleman clothing, and textiles business. She began her business just to enable her to provide some of her basic needs for herself. Her business is located at city centre and her main customers are both men and women. Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 650,000 every month from this business. 

Nancy would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional business stock. She hopes that this loan will help her with more income to enable her to provide her basic needs. 

In the future, Nancy still maintains the plan of running to Guinea. She is saying thanks to Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, suitcases and DVDs.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy vegetables like onions, garlic, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, and other vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables.

Amalia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice and selling dried fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses buying and selling vegetables and rice and dried fish vending.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Ariunzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariunzul, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2011 and is quite experienced at his taxi service. She herself has been working at a court as an information and referral service staff member for one year. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. She is requesting a loan of 2,600,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, foams, bricks and planks. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and inuslation materials such as fiberglass, planks and foam.

loans.name: Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fraternidad está trabajando en su sexto ciclo, ellas son todas mujeres, amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Se unieron con el objetivo de ayudar a sus familias y a ellas mismas por medio del programa de comité.
La Sra. francisca se dedica a la venta de lencería, tanto de hombres como para mujeres, ella se define como una persona con habilidad para las ventas ya que le va muy bien. Tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compra de ella sus hermosos productos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería, ya que quiere poder seguir dando a sus clientes buenos productos y así también poder atraer a nuevos clientes.
texts.en: Francisca is engaged in selling lingerie, to both men and women.  She is characterized as a person with sales ability and her business is going very well.  She has well-established customers that always buy her beautiful products from her.  She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of lingerie because she wants to continue providing her customers with good products and, in this way, always be able to attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Karya Mandiri 2 Group

texts.en:
Suwandi is a father of two who lives in Jakarta City. He is a diligent entrepreneur.  His business is selling men's and women's shoes to the pedestrians at the main street.   Through his work, he earns a living for his family.

He buys the shoes from a factory then resells them again at an affordable price. His business is the only place in the street that sells shoes which is an advantage for him over his competitors among the street vendors.

With the loan, he will rent a more permanent kiosk in the nearby market where he can run his business and add a greater variety of shoe types to his inventory. By doing so, he hopes to increase his income for the family and children's education. Suwandi will use this loan to increase the capital available to buy shoes and sandals.

Suwandi expects to be able to grow his business and generate more income which will allow him to have some savings in order to send both of his children to higher education.

loans.use: to buy 100 pairs of shoe and sandals.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 55 years-old and has two children who are in school.

Rosemarie has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Rosemarie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for four years. Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed school supplies and products needed in her store, and she was able to support her family as well. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. She also sells cellphone accessories for additional income.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy more stock of school supplies. She will also use the money for buying cellphone accessories. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma dreams to have a stall inside the mall and hopes to give her child a good life and a future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of school supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 64 years old and married with six children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like bread, snack foods, candies, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., to sell in her general store.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Veronica aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like bread, snack foods, candies, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbold, 28 years-old, lives with his family in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. In 2004, he worked as a driver for a private business entity and in 2005, he went to Korea on a three year employment contract. After his return, he began working as a taxi driver at another private business. His wife used to work as a saleswoman at a store and recently went on maternity leave. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT in order to purchase insulation and building materials such as fiber glass, foam, bricks and plants. As a result, the family will live in more comfortable and warm place. The renovated house will not allow heat loss and enable the family to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiber glass, foam and planks.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 43-year-old married man and a father of four children. He is from Talibon, Bohol.

He is engaged in a hog raising business and he also runs a sari-sari (variety store). Roberto is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell in his sari-sari, such as canned goods, soda, noodles and rice, and to buy piglets to raise. With this, he will be able to improve his business and augment his income. In the future, Roberto hopes of expanding his ventures and experiencing a fullness of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in his sari-sari, such as canned goods, soda, noodles and rice, and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the grocery products required for her variety store. She was able to help her family in terms of finances as well. She has been in this business for six years now. Eufemia and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family will live happily and peacefully. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 59 years old, and is married with three children. Wilfreda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks, such as coffee, bread, milk and canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Wilfreda has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, such as coffee, bread, milk and canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell (Saba , Lacatan and Tondan Varieties)

loans.name: Maximilla

texts.en:
Maximilla is a 48-year-old woman who is married to Jermias, aged 51. Maximilla and Jermias are blessed with three children and all of them now have work in another island. 

Maximilla owns a plot of land, on which she cultivates vegetables, tomatoes, beans, chilli and rice paddy. She usually sells the produce in the market. Prior to running this business Maximilla operated a kiosk business, but Maximilla decided to close her kiosk business, and concentrate on the current business to enable her to generate more income. 

Maximilla has plans to cultivate more vegetables, but she needs more money to buy more seedlings and fertilizer. Therefore she has requested a loan from TLM of IDR 10,000,000. Maximilla hopes that she wil be able to improve her business with the loan assistance from TLM.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Angelina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials for fishing and spare parts for the maintenance of her pump-boat for her fishing business.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing and spare parts for the maintenance of her pump-boat.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable growing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.

Dionesia has successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her vegetable business. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dionesia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to buy additional farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a 56-year-old widow with three children. 

Melly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling fashion products, and has been running this business for two years. Melly earns additional income from a general store.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ready to wear products to sell in her business.

Melly aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional of ready to wear products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
El Sr. Teofilo tiene 46 años, está  casado con la Sra. Blanca de 44 años de edad tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, que ya son independientes y cada uno ya tiene su familia formada.
Teofilo empezó a trabajar con su padre en la producción y venta de productos hortícolas, actualmente con la ayuda de su padre ya tiene un camión para realizar la venta de verduras y frutas que vende recorriendo por la ciudad,  y también realiza fletes en su camión y así poder brindarles a su familia una vida digna.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más tomates, cebollas y frutas en general para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener un mayor ingreso para ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en: Teofilo is 46 years old.  He is married to Blanca, age 44, and they have three independent, adult children and each one has his/her own family.  Teofilo began working with his father in the production and sale of horticultural products.  Currently, with his father’s help, he already has a truck that he uses to sell fruits and vegetables while traveling through the city.  He also carries freight in his truck and, in this way, he is able to provide his family with a dignified life.  He is requesting the loan to purchase more tomatoes, onions, and fruit in order to be able to continue with his sales and, and in this way, have more income to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número uno donde todas se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Todas son conocidas en el barrio por la unión y el esfuerzo qu demuestran.
Luz es parte de este grupo, ella se unió con el objetivo de poder crecer y ayudar a su familia. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que por medio de la venta de joyas que hace está tratando de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Luz cuenta que gracias  a que tiene buena habilidad para las ventas le esta yendo bien.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de joyas de plata de todo tipo y clase, con lo que podrá seguir impresionando a su clientela con una buena variedad.
texts.en: The “Maria Auxiliadora” Communal Bank is in its first loan cycle.  All of the members have set a goal for the growth of each person in the group, not only financially, but also personally.  All of them are known in the neighborhood for their union and the effort that they demonstrate.  Luz is a member of this group.  She joined with the goal of being able to grow and help her family.  She is a very enterprising woman who is sells jewelry to try to help her family and get them ahead.  Luz says that thanks to her good sales ability, her business is going well.  She is requesting this loan to purchase all types and kinds of silver jewelry that will enable her to continue impressing her customers with a good variety.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mobark

texts.en:
Mobark is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He started his business by opening a small grocery store with a small amount of capital. He not only uses his business as a source of income but for social purposes such as helping the poor by providing them with lowest prices. Recently, Mobark's business has decreased, leading to a decrease in his profits. He has had to stop selling his product to poorer people, because of the current bad situation which Yemen faces. 

He is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB, in order to purchase grocery products for his business. In this way, he hopes to increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for his business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 65 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Milagros has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 40 years. 

She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 54 years old, married to Margaret and a father of four children. He is a dairy farmer, and has been in this business for four years. George earns a monthly income of 35,000 shillings.

This will be George's third loan with KADET LTD, which he plans to use to pay for a water connection from the river to his home.

loans.use: to pay for a water connection from the river to his home.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 58 years old, married and has six children.

Guillerma is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 19 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

This time, she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Guillerma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Mazide Ismail

texts.en:
Mazide benefited from the previous loans as follows: he has increased his working capital, bought a lot of ground nuts, and has paid part of his childrens' school fees.

He is now taking a new loan to buy more ground nuts, Mazide said that he is happy for FSSL's support to his business.

loans.use: to buy more ground nuts.

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил торгует овощами и фруктами на оптовом рынке Виноградово. Торгует из собственного микроавтобуса. Занимается этим уже 7 лет. Наемных рабочих нет. 
Михаил собирается использовать полученную от КИВА сумму в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести яблоки, лук, морковь и свеклу по закупочным ценам и потом выгодно их реализовать. Со временем Михаил надеется накопить достаточно средств, чтобы достроить свой дом.
texts.en: Mikhail sells vegetables and fruits at the wholesale market in Vinogradovo.  He sells from his own van.  He has been in this business for 7 years.  He does not have employees.  Mikhail plans to use the sum of 15,000 hryvnia that he receives from KIVA to buy apples, onions, carrots and beets at purchase prices and then to sell them at a profit.  With time Mikhail hopes to save enough money to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy apples, onions, carrots and beets at purchase prices and then to sell them at a profit

loans.name: 13 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  13 de junio está dejando atrás el ciclo uno para aventurarse en el ciclo dos. Ellas son mujeres que quieren salir adelante y se están esforzando al máximo para poder hacerlo.
Silvia es una mujer que realmente quiere salir adelante y es por eso que trabaja el doble, ya que se dedica a ser empleada domestica y también hace trabajos de peluquería. Silvia lucha por su familia, para darles todo lo que pueda de acuerdo a sus posibilidades, y que así no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, gel, shampoo, enjuagues y demás, para poder seguir dando su servicio de peluquera y así tener un mejor ingreso que ayudará a su familia.
texts.en: The “13 de Junio” [June 13th] Communal Bank is out-pacing cycle one to venture into cycle two.  They are women that want to get ahead and are making every effort to do so.  Silvia is a woman that really wants to get ahead and this is the reason she works double; she is a housekeeper and she is also a hairdresser.  Silvia strives for her family and gives them everything she can, according to her means, so that they never have to do without necessities.She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of dyes, gel, shampoo, rinses, and other products to continue providing hairdressing services and, thereby, have a better income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, gel, shampoo, rinses, ans other items to use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.ru:
Евгения занимается тепличным хозяйством в с.Подстепное. Она начала заниматься этим 12 лет назад. На данный момент на 95 сотках земли она выращивает два урожая огурцов, а также помидоры, редис, картофель. 
Сумму в 15 000 гривен Евгения планирует вложить в содержание и усовершенствование тепличного хозяйства, а именно подготовить теплицы к сезону, закупить семена, пленку и установить капельное орошение.
texts.en:
Yevgeniya is a greenhouse farmer in the village of Podstepnoye.  She started this business 12 years ago.  Today she grows two harvests of cucumbers and also tomatoes, radishes and potatoes on 95 acres of land.  

Yevgeniya plans to invest the sum of 15,000 hryvnia into the support and updating of her greenhouse farm, and specifically to prepare the greenhouse for the season: purchase seeds, film and install drip irrigation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, film and install drip irrigation

loans.name: Maritza  Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza es una joven de 25 años, nació en un hogar de escasos recursos en donde recibió el apoyo para termina la educación primaria. Desde muy joven trabajó en su casa y con el tiempo se independizó para vivir y formar un hogar con su pareja Augusto con quien tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en una escuela fiscal y a quienes espera poderlos apoyar hasta la culminación de sus carreras profesionales. Maritza vive junto a su familia en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una ciudad que cuenta un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Sus varios atractivos turísticos acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Maritza ha visto la necesidad de aportar en su hogar para la educación de sus hijos y cubrir los gastos básicos de la casa, por lo que hace dos años comenzó a comercializar cosméticos por cuenta propia gracias al consejo de amigos. Para no descuidar los quehaceres del hogar y el apoyo que ella brinda a sus hijos con sus tareas, trabaja apenas 3 horas en las que tiene que arreglárselas para entregar pedidos y ofrecer sus productos. Maritza desea invertir en un negocio fijo en el que pueda al mismo tiempo atender los quehaceres del hogar y a sus hijos, es por esto que solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará en la adecuación de un local para instalar un restaurante de comida típica  de la zona que ella tan bien prepara con el sazón único de su familia. El mayor obstáculo que le ha impedido emprender en este negocio antes, ha sido la falta de capital, obstáculo que ahora es derribado gracias al apoyo de Fundación Alternativa y Kiva que además de apoyo, confianza y agilidad, dan la oportunidad a otras personas alrededor del mundo para ser parte de este sueño. Con el establecimiento de su restaurante Maritza no dejará de vender cosméticos, pues destinará una vitrina para el pequeño stock que mantiene y así podrá obtener mayor utilidad y brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza is 25 years old and comes from a family of scarce resources. She was only able to finish primary school, and from a very young age Maritza has worked hard to help her family make ends meet. She and her partner, Augusto, have two children and live in their own home. Maritza’s children are in school, and she hopes to be able to support them in their studies all the way through to the completion of professional degrees. 

Maritza and her family live in the parish of Río Verde de Santo Domingo, which is located in the capital of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province. The city of Río Verde has a growing business sector, and is also a centrally located zone that connects the mountainous and coastal regions of the country. With a warm climate and many tourist attractions, Río Verde has become a popular destination for foreign and Ecuadoran tourists. With the influx of tourism, the people of Río Verde have adapted and learned various trades and crafts that both support and benefit from the tourist industry. 

In response to growing education and household costs, Maritza started a business selling cosmetics at the suggestion of some of her friends. As a complement to her household duties and time spent with her kids, Maritza works an average of three hours every day managing client orders, delivering products to customers and sharing her products with prospective clients. Ultimately, Maritza wants to invest in a stable business that will allow her to balance the personal and professional aspects of life. With her goals in mind, Maritza is requesting this loan, and she plans to use the support from the loan to set up her own small restaurant where she can prepare delicious food dishes that draw on her family’s unique recipes, flavor and tradition.

The greatest challenge that has impeded Maritza’s progress in this business endeavor up until now is her lack of access to startup capital and funds. She is very grateful for the support and confidence she has received from Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, and for the support they provide in helping people all over the world fulfill their dreams. When she is able to get her restaurant up and running, Maritza does not plan to stop selling cosmetics, but rather to install a display case for her products in the new restaurant in hopes of combining her two businesses and improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to set up a display case for her cosmetics and undertake the new challenge of opening up a small restaurant.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Emanuel, who is in his 20s, is a married man staying together with his wife. Since 2007, Mr. Emanuel has been managing his family through running a shop selling different electronic equipment, such as quality radios and TVs of different sizes and types, and other electrical items. He is doing well in this field together with his family. He works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be Emanuel's 18th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he manged to expand his shop by purchasing more stock of TVs, radios and other electronics items. With the profit earned, he reinvested back into the business, bought a plot of land where he started building his house and covered home expenses. He will use this loan to restock more TVs, radios and other missing items in the shop. He dreams to finish building his house and be a big businessman. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Pamoja," which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more TVs, radios and other missing items in the shop.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita works hard to support her family. Lita is married and has a livestock business in the Philippines.

Lita requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to buy additional livestock to sell.

Lita has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Lita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Gladis Rosibel

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas y vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Gladys  tiene hace 2 años un negocio de venta de baleadas,  refrescos y agua de coco. Este negocio lo estableció con la necesidad de generar un ingreso que le ayudara a solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos, trabaja desde la mañana para atender a los clientes.
Solicito un préstamo de 6,000 lempiras para comprar los insumos necesarios para vender como harina y cocos. Con esta inversión piensa mejorar la calidad de servicio y atender mejor a sus clientes.
Su meta es ampliar su negocio y poder construir una caseta para atender mejor.
texts.en: Gladis, 33, is a single mother with two daughters. She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula. For two years, she has had a business selling baleadas (wheat flour tortillas with fried beans and other ingredients), soft drinks, and coconut water. She set up this business because she needed to generate income to help her meet household expenses. She has no help from the father of her children. She starts working in the morning attend to customers. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy the necessary ingredients like flour and coconuts. With this investment, she plans to improve the quality of her service and better attend to her customers. Her goal is to expand her business and to build a stand to better attend to them.

loans.use: to buy supplies, wheat flour to make baleadas, and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mirian Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Mirian tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Mirian tiene un negocio de venta de manualidades. Ella elabora las prendas de lana como, juego de forros para sala, baño, licuadoras, manteles etc. Su sueño por tener su propio negocio la impulso para dedicarse hace 8 años a esta actividad. Manifiesta que las ventas  le dejan buenas ganancias.
Ella ha trabajado varios créditos con Odef, actualmente pide el sexto de 8,000 lempira los cuales invertirá en comprar materia prima como hilos de lana de variedad de colores para elaborar las prendas.
Su meta es, con las ganancias que obtenga le hará mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Mirian, 51, is married and has two children. She lives in the city of Choloma, Cortes. She has a business selling handicrafts. She makes things out of wool, such as blankets and covers for the living room, the bathroom, blenders, etc. Her dream is to have her own business. She started this work eight years ago. She says that the sales bring her good profits. She has received several loans from Odef. She is currently asking for a sixth loan of 8,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy raw materials like wool thread in assorted colors to make the covers. Her goal is to make improvements to her home with her profits.

loans.use: to buy wool thread to make blankets, blender covers, covers for the bathroom, and other wool decorations.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 36 años de edad , esta casado con Victoria con quien tiene 3 hijos y junto a su familia reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble.
Jorge se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles , el cual es el principal sustento para su familia,lleva en este negocio más de 7 años , tiempo en el que ha ido ganando experiencia total en el rubro logrando establecer su negocio al punto de convertirse en una buena manera de estar al lado de sus hijos y su esposa , actualmente planea adquirir productos de primera necesidad al por mayor con el afán de tener reservas para el futuro así como la confección de un andamio adicional para la exhibición de sus productos , adicional a ello realizará el pintado de su local para hacerlo mas atractivo.
Con el monto solicitado de  S/.3,500 nuevos soles realizara la compra al por mayor de productos comestibles tales como arroz , azúcar , leche , entre otros ,así como la contrata de la persona encargada de la confección de un andamio y el pintado de su local por está razón se muestra muy contento por el apoyo financiero que recibe ya que le ayuda a seguir con el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Jorge, 36, is married to Victoria, with whom he has three children. Together with his family, he lives in a house built out of solid materials. Jorge works selling edible goods, which is the main means of supporting his family. He has had this business for more than seven years, during which he has gained experience in the field, making his business a good way to be next to his children and his wife. He is currently planning to buy basic goods wholesale, with the hope of having reserves in the future. He also wants to build an additional shelf to display his goods. He will also paint his store to make it more attractive. With the amount he has applied for, 3,500 nuevos soles, he will buy wholesale foodstuffs like rice, sugar, and milk, among other things. He will also hire someone to build the shelf and paint his store. This is why he is so glad for the financial support that he is receiving, because it will help him to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and pay a worker.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar de 60 años, casado, padre de tres hijos, originario del departamento de Chinandega ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua, Julio es un hombre trabajador, responsable, el ha tenido que luchar desde muy joven para lograr salir adelante y asi obtener el alimento diario para su hogar, lamentablemente el por falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar sus estudios logrando cursar solamente la primaria, en sus ratos libres le gusta mucho compartir con sus hijos anécdotas pasadas con ellos, al igual que escuchar música, cantar con ellos, gracias a su empeño y ganas de salir adelante se dedica a la compra y venta de sacos vacíos, ya sean nuevos y usados  negocio que inicio hace 22 años, con producto importado del país vecino, la mayoría de sus clientes son  ganaderos y agricultores ya que esta zona es una de las más productivas del país, a pesar que solo distribuye un tipo de producto, Julio vende sacos de diferente tipo de calidad para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para capitalizar su negocio
texts.en: Julio Cesar, 60, is married and has three children. He is originally from Chinandega Department, located in western Nicaragua. Julio is a hard-working and responsible man. He has had to struggle since he was very young to be able to move forward and earn daily bread for his household. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, he was not able to finish school. He only went to primary school. In his free time, he likes to tell his children stories from the past, as well as listen to music and sing with them. Thanks to his effort and his desire to move forward, he works buying and selling empty sacks, whether they are new or used. He started this business 22 years ago, with products imported from a neighboring country. Most of his customers are ranchers and farmers, since this area is one of the most productive in the country. Despite the fact that he only distributes one type of product, Julio sells different kinds of quality sacks to meet his customers' needs. He is asking for the loan to capitalize his business.

loans.use: to invest more in his business since demand has increased and to buy sacks.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia, 53, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lydia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lydia hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To decorate the salon and buy equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is glad to be associated with Milango. He started off as a hired driver; he then applied for a loan and purchased a second-hand motorcycle, which he has used to go into business for himself. Onesmus is grateful and happy about the progress his business is making. He now intends to buy another motorcycle.

Onesmus is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings, which he will use to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 27 years old, single, and has no dependents. He is in the transportation business; he provides transport services using his motorbike. He started this business two years ago, and he has been earning a monthly income of KES 19,000.

Joseph requested a second loan, in the amount of KES 100,000, to purchase a new motorbike. The profit he earns will help him to open a new line of business, as well as to repay his loan. He dreams of owning a vehicle by the end of the year.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Lemi Lino

texts.en:
Lemi Lino is a 28-year-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married with two children between the ages of three and six. Both of them go to school. Lemi Lino runs a clothes-selling business and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase more clothes and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of Income.

In five years, Lemi Lino would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Lemi Lino says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and single. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Her hope and dream is to improve her living situation and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda is 32 years old. He lives with his mother, in a small village in Tsageri District. Imeda requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production, and two pigs. In addition, they have a hectare of agricultural land, where they cultivate potatoes. They can hardly afford enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Imeda requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to regular credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Imeda will purchase 30 sheep. After purchasing the sheep, he will be able to expand his livestock business and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sheep

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 36 years old and from a small village in the Kaspi district. She is married and lives with her husband, two children and mother-in-law. Lali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Their only source of the income is from their vineyard where they pick grapes and make their own wine to sell. It is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lali requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved because of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the loan, Lali will purchase used clothing from wholesalers and then resale at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is now acquiring his 10th loan with UGAFODE Microfinance. The loans have moved him miles in changing his lifestyle. For better service delivery, Martin continuously renovates and adds value to his rental houses, to keep them at the required standard and make them competitive.

With this loan, old Martin will buy paint to paint the building, in order to make it attractive to potential tenants. Martin is an innovative old man. Martin also wants to thank the Kiva lenders for the partnership, this being his third loan on Kiva. He is confident the partnership will continue to grow to great heights.

loans.use: To paint his rental building, to make it attractive to potential tenants.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josephat is now 31 years old, and living with his family. He is still operating his phone accessories and repair shop, and his monthly income has risen to KES 12,000.  

Now, he has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD. He wishes to use this amount to add more phone accessories for his shop. The profits he gets will be used to repay the loan and for his family's upkeep. His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase handset covers, batteries and phones for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecili, 36, is married to Robert and a mother to two children. She operates a grocery store in Kiambu and has recently opened a beauty salon in the same area. Cecili has been in the grocery business for four years. Cecilia earns a  monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This will be Cecilia's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the loan to buy beauty products, like hair oil, hair chemicals, hair pieces, etc. In the future, Cecili wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy products such as hair oil, hair chemicals and hair pieces for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's group is comprised of seven hard working women. Sylvia is 16 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her business selling medicine/pharmaceutical products. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock more drugs to sell, and will help Sylvia  to generate greater profits and income to buy her a house. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on the business. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase and stock more drugs to sell

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a married man, 28, with two children between six and three years old. .He is a matatu operator serving the Kapsabetears and Eldoret routes and has been in the business for a period of five years. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD to purchase a piece of land to till. The profits that he earns from his matatu business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

His dream is to develop his plot and purchase more land.

loans.use: To purchase land to till

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 37 years old and from a small village in Martvili District. He is married and lives with his wife, two children and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Gocha has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is Gocha’s small monthly income working as a baker at local bakery. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Gocha will rent a bakery. He plans to start his own bakery and increase the income of the family. He has chosen a commercial space, which is in very crowded area, so he hopes that the business will be profitable. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to rent a bakery and start his own business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a lady of 40 years, married to Dominic and a mother of four children. She is a tailor in Kiambu town. She has been in this business for ten years. Grace earns a monthly income of twenty-five thousand Kenyan shillings.

This will be Grace's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy new fabric and other materials for making clothes. She wants to be a prosperous businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To buy new fabric and materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her grocery store business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, sugar, cereals, potatoes and tomatoes. She gives thanks to Kiva lenders and Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar, cereals, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Rahab Wanja

texts.en: Rahab is 49 years old, and she has applied for her fifth loan from KADET LTD. She wants the loan to enable her to buy a heifer. Rahab used the previous loan well, and her business did very well. She is grateful that it helped her and enabled her to earn profits. Rahab is optimistic that her business will do even better after this loan.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 37 years, married and blessed with four children who are school going. She is a farmer in Kapsabet mainly dealing with both dairy and horticulture. She has been farming for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 10,000 from the sale of the farm products.

She has asked for a first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD to purchase tea seedlings and till more land. The profits she earns from the sale of her farm produce will be used to pay the loan and meet her family's daily expenses.

Her dream is to own several tea estates.

loans.use: To purchase tea seedlings and till more land

loans.name: Medard &mellon

texts.en:
Mellon and Medard are married, and they are residing in Nyamuhani Cell, Ntungamo District, Uganda. They are both teachers, whose income is not enough to support them to build a permanent residential house. Their current house was customary and in poor condition, having been given to the husband by his father.

Today, the couple wants to buy land where they can put a foundation, looking forward to building a better residential house to accommodate their children. They are a hard-working and committed couple. In the photo is the couple and the UGAFODE credit officer (right).

loans.use: To buy a piece of land where they can eventually build a home

loans.name: Diah

texts.en: Diah runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone airtime credits. She is a housewife and has five persons living in her house. She joined Ruma 10 months ago because the Ruma Field officer services are very helpful. Besides, she wants to increase her income and feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, she has around $62/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she needs more working capital to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items for her grocery store. She has been in this business for eleven years and it continues to grow. She and her husband are working hard, to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 9,000 PHP. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ofelia hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages and the like, to add to her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a compressor

loans.name: Roni

texts.en: Roni runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, homemade food, and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur and has four peoples living in his house. He joined Ruma 10 months ago because he wanted to increase his income and still feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, he has around $68/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is 36 years old, and she is a divorced mother of two kids. Her children attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has had a grocery store for one year. She started the business with her own savings. The income from this business now covers the household expenses, as well as school fees.

Mose is seeking a loan in order to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, cookies, candy and drinks, which are the top-selling items in her business. This will enable her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, and allow for the possibility of increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, cookies, candy and drinks

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married and has three school-going children. She owns a house without electricity or piped water. For the last two years, she has been selling food products in her grocery store to earn a living and support her family.

She is requesting a loan of KSHS 15,000 to buy cooking oil, maize flour, sugar, and bags of wheat to sell in order to get money to boost her capital and even her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, maize flour, sugar, and wheat to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
