Josphine is 59 years old, is married and has six adult children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Josphine started her home-based chicken business 27 years ago and now has established customers. She is also a farmer and sells farm produce. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy chicks and chicken feed, which she can buy at better prices in quantity. This will also allow her to do better business by offering a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Cheryl is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, vinegar, food seasoning and other items. With this, she will be able to sell to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Cheryl hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, vinegar, food seasoning and other items

loans.name: María Eduarda

texts.es:
María tiene 56 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos no vive con ellos. Ella vive con  su esposo, Persona que está jubilado y se desempeño como conserje en el Hospital Nacional de la ciudad,  sus tres hijos  son personas independientes económicamente, uno es locutor y evangelista cristiano y sus otros dos hijos son empleados de supermercados en la ciudad.

Se dedica a la venta alimentos tradicionales que prepara a base de maíz, y yuca como  atoles, pupusas, nuegados; también, vende blusas y ropa de niños y sandalias de hule. Las materias primas para preparar los alimentos las adquiere en el mercado municipal y la ropa y las sandalias las compra asociada con una amiga miembro de la misma iglesia con el objetivo de negociar mejores precios.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar un saldo pendiente con la institución y el resto para comprar ropa y calzado para la venta; también, comprara láminas para el techo de su vivienda, de no hacerlo se le mojaran sus pertenencias y las madera de la estructura se le dañará, por eso se esta anticipando reparar  a la época de lluvias. (Mes mayo)

Con el financiamiento mejorará su capacidad de compra de mercaderías para cumplir con la demanda que posee y al realizar las mejoras en el techo de la vivienda evitará se le deteriore la estructura del techo de su vivienda y el exceso de humedad que puede propiciar el ambiente favorable para enfermedades respiratorias y el desarrollo de insectos.


Su propósito es, trabajar en el negocio de venta de alimentos, ropa y calzados; un día establecer una tienda un su casa.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom has left home. She lives with her retired husband who worked as a caretaker at the national hospital in the city. Their three children are financially independent; one is a radio announcer and a Christian evangelist, and the other two work in a local supermarket.

María sells traditional food which she makes from corn and yuca: corn-based drinks, stuffed tortillas, and fried dumplings. She also sells blouses, children’s clothing, and rubber sandals. The ingredients for the food are bought in the municipal market, and the clothing and sandals from a friend who is a member of the same church. 

The loan María is seeking from Fundación Campo is to settle a payment that is due with the institution, and the rest will be used to buy clothing and footwear to sell. As well, she will buy sheeting for the roof of their house so that their belongings do not get wet. The wood is rotten so María wants to have the roof repaired before the rainy season (the month of May).

The loan will give her more capacity to buy merchandise for her customers, and repair the roof of her house. This will prevent the roof from deteriorating further and causing illnesses and insect infestations from the damp conditions.

María’s goal is to continue selling food, clothing and footwear. One day she would like to open a store in her house.

loans.use: buy clothing and footwear, and repair the roof of the house

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 45, is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is a seamstress who, over time and after getting experience, opened her own workshop. She began with a single sewing machine and now has two. Her husband is a businessman and between them they have provided everything for their children.

In the future, her goal is to expand her workshop and to buy more machines and provide jobs for others. She is applying for this loan so that she can buy fabric and thread to keep working and meeting her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to keep working and meeting her customers' needs.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 55 years old. She brews and sells local beer. She has been in the business for eight years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum with which to make more local beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum with which to make more local beer to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is from Tiribe. She works selling fruits and vegetables, in a little shed at the entrance to the village.

With sacrifice, dedication, and the help of her husband, she managed to get her children ahead. She is a very hard-working woman. She says she always has worked, and she is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and have a bigger shed, so she can continue helping her family and her husband.

Josphine is coming to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva, for a loan.  She will use it to buy vegetables to resell, such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions, as well as seasonal fruits. These purchases will enable her to supply her business with top-quality produce to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions, as well as seasonal fruits, to resell at her greengrocer shed

loans.name: Miriam Elena

texts.es: Miriam Elena  38 años de edad, casada con tres hijos, originaria del departamento de Chinandega,  es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, que ha tenido que luchar desde muy joven para salir adelante y asi obtener su alimento diario. En sus ratos libre le gusta mucho escuchar música del variadas al lado de su familia. Gracias a su espíritu de luchadora y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica en  venta de mercadería en general como ropa nueva, cosméticos, prendas de oros chinerías y otros productos más, este negocio lo incia hace 6 años, ubicado de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación. ella  tiene una  rutina diaria de  trabajar unas 8 horas diarias. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería y aprovecha la temporada de la Semana Santa  para ofrecer productos como: camisetas, camisolines, bikinis, short, sandalias, cremas para la piel entre otros productos más, ya que en este momento todo sus productos los tiene en cuentas por cobrar los cuales ella recupera semanal y quincenal.
texts.en:
Miriam Elena, 38, married with three children, is from the district of Chinandega. She is a hard working, responsible woman who has had to fight since she was very young to get ahead and get food on a daily basis. 

In her free time she likes to listen to different types of music with her family. 

Thanks to her fighter spirit and her desire to get ahead she has a business selling merchandize such as new clothes, cosmetics, costume jewelry etc. 

She started this business six years ago. She sells her merchandise on the street as well as in her home. She has a daily routine of working eight hours a day. She takes great pleasure in her work since this has been the way of life for her and her family. 

The loan will be used to invest in working capital and stock her business for the buying and selling of merchandise and take advantage of the Easter season to offer products such as: shirts, gowns, bikinis, shorts, sandals and skin creams etc..

Currently she has all her products in credit accounts that she recovers weekly and quarterly.

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy children's clothes, adult beach and dress clothes and other products.

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en:
Maylin is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a service business, which is laminating pictures in the local community, to earn a living. She has been in business for over six years and earns 14,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase additional materials for laminating pictures. Her hope and dream is to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for laminating pictures

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 35 years old, married, and lives with her five children in Msambweni. Fatuma has a beauty salon, and it is one of the Msambweni, with an established clientele, clearly because of the time she has spent on it. She is a self-sacrificing woman, and thanks to her effort and sacrifices she could get ahead in her business. She says that her business provides the family income and is very helpful. She is considered to be a hard-working person and a fighter. She wants to continue with her beauty salon business, and thus be able to support her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy tools and supplies for her salon, such as shears, sprays, and gels, among other items. She is grateful for the opportunity Yehu Microfinance Trust has given her.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for her salon, such as shears, sprays, and gels, among other items.

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en: Xaverine is 48 years old. She is married with nine children between 4 and 24 years old. Her husband works as a farmer. She sells local beers and has been doing this business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum for making local beers. The profits will be used for nothing other than savings and paying a portion of it for school fees. Xaverine is very thankful for the previous loan that helped her and entire business to grow.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory such as cough medicine.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Mohamed from Sierra Leone. He is married with no children. He also supports another relative in his household. 

Mohamed runs a general merchandise store in Jui. He requests the loan to buy more inventory in order to expand his business. He started his business in 2010 and works many hours a day, seven days a week. He hopes that his business will be one of the largest ones in the area. He says that sometimes sales can be unpredictable and slow. He is grateful to BRAC and Kiva for the loan to help improve the life of his family. He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is married and has five school-going children. She owns a house with piped water but without electricity. For the last two years, she has been selling vegetables and piped water to earn a living.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy various kinds of vegetables for sale, and she will use part of it to enable her to repair the water tap that is leaking to avoid wasting water.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables for sale and to repair the leaking water tap.

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en: Alexie is 47 years old. She owns a retail store selling different items, and has spent 10 years in the business. She wants the loan to add more retail items for sale such as rice, sugar, salt and cooking oil. The profits from this business will be used to buy a motorbike to be used as another source of income. She added more items, such as 20 liters of cooking oil, with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Please meet 36-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo, Sierra Leone. He is married with two children, aged 3 and 7. They both currently go to school. His wife is also in business. 

Mohamed owns a motor spare-parts business and has been operating it for the past 10 years. He started in the industry because he had an uncle who encouraged him to go into business because it was profitable. He works 10 hours per day, seven days per week at his business.  

In five years, he wants his business to grow to become the distributor to various spare-parts shops in the country and employ other people. He says that transportation of his spare parts from the city is a major challenge. He requested the loan to purchase more inventory such as motor engine oil, rings and brake fluid in order to expand his business. He is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as motor engine oil, rings and brake fluid.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José es un joven de 23 años quien es soltero y vive en Sololá. Actualmente  vive con sus padres y  su pareja en  unión libre.
El cuenta con una venta de variedades en el interior del mercado,  la cual lleva 5 años de tener su negocio y gracias a Dios todo le ha ido bien porque ha sabido adminístralo y de está manera puede mantener a su pareja  y padres.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 9,000.00 para capital de trabajo ya que desea  ampliar su venta de variedades  y así generar mejores ingresos ya que las ganancias son aceptables.
Uno de sus sueños es construir su casa para vivir con su familia,  porque  aun vive  con sus padres.
texts.en:
José, 23, is single and lives in Sololá.  Currently he lives with his parents and his common-law partner.

He has a general store inside the market.  He has had the business for five years and he's thankful to God that everything has gone well for him because he has learned how to run the business and can support his partner and his parents with it.

He's requesting a loan for 9,000 quetzales [GTQ] for working capital.  He wants to expand his store and generate more income because his profits are reasonable.

One of his dreams is to build his house to live in with his family, because he still lives with his parents.

loans.use: to have working capital to expand his store

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
This is Ernesto, 47, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Josephine and is a father to their children. He helps his wife in managing their household as they both work to provide income for their everyday needs. 

Ernesto maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one unit of tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. They have four units of tricycles. The three other tricycles are being used by other tricycle drivers who then remit their daily quota to him. He earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP (Philippines pesos) in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting an amount of 20,000 PHP for his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his four tricycle units. He has to maintain the units in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Ernesto dreams that he will have more tricycles and hopes to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his four tricycle units.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijas, con las edades de 11, 6 y 3 años, la vivienda la construyeron de bloque en terreno que le heredó el papá, este también dependen económicamente de él, esto debido a que no puede trabajar como jornalero por la discapacidad que padece a causa de que fue atropellado por un vehículo. José, trabaja como despachador de 29 buses que hacen su recorrido desde su comunidad a la ciudad, aquí le pagan $11.00 por día. La esposa trabaja en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, elaborando alimentos a base de harinas de maíz, yuca, papas y plátanos como enchiladas, tostadas de yuca, plátanos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un coche con freidor incorporado para freír tostadas de plátano, yucas, papas y compra golosinas, frijol, arroz, azúcar, aceites, café y bebidas gaseosas y refrescos para instalar una pequeña tienda en su casa y sea el papá quien la administre.

Proveer de capital de trabajo inicial para que inicien con el negocio de la tienda, con esto el papá del solicitante apoyará en la generación de ingresos a la familia y compren el coche con freidor (equipo) que le sirva a la esposa en su negocio.

Que la tienda que instale en su vivienda funcione y genere los ingresos suficientes  que permitan a  la esposa del cliente atenderla y a cuidar sus hijas en su casa, considera que las descuidan por atender sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old. He is married and has three daughters who are 11, 6, and 3 years old. Their house was built from concrete blocks on land that he inherited from his father. His father is also economically dependent on him, because he can’t work as a day laborer due to the disability that he suffered from being hit by a vehicle. 

José works as a bus dispatcher for 29 buses that make their routes from his community to the city; they pay him 11 dollars per day. His wife works in the city’s municipal market, preparing baked foods made from corn, cassava, potatoes, and plantains such as enchiladas and toasted cassava and plantains.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase a car with a deep-fryer installed in order to fry plantains, cassava, and potatoes; and to purchase candy, beans, rice, sugar, candy, oil, coffee, and soft drinks in order to install a small store in his house; his father will be the one who runs it. 

It will provide them with some initial working capital so that they can start their store; with this, his father will support him in generating income for the family, and they will purchase a car with a deep-fryer installed that will help his wife with her business. 

Hopefully the store that they will install in their house will do well and generate sufficient income that will allow his wife to attend her business and care for their daughters in their house; he feels that they’ve been overlooking this in trying to attend to their economic activities.

loans.use: to purchase a car with a deep-fryer installed in order to fry plantains, cassava, and potatoes; and to purchase candy, beans, rice, sugar, candy, oil, coffee, and soft drinks in order to install a small store in his house; his father will be the one who runs it.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is 42 years old and married with three children. He lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting mango to earn a living. He has been in his business for over nine years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for mango production. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for mango production.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of 10 children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Leonila is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the boat and plywood for the boat. With this loan, they will be able to improve their fishing business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fuel and plywood for the boat.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is from the village of Msambweni. She lives with her partner and children, all of whom attend school.

Rose has been buying and selling charcoal and coconuts for more than five years. She carries out this business with support of her husband. She is a very selfless and hard-working person who would like to be able to help her family make progress and get ahead in life. Her wish is to continue growing in her business so that she can continue helping her family.

Rose is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to stock her business and meet her customers' demands. She is very happy to receive the help of Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to stock her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 38 años de edad es una excelente madre soltera que con mucho amor y dedicación cuida de sus dos hijas: Andrea y Jimena con quienes vive en la casa de su padre desde hace 3 años.   
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura y principales cultivos constan de papa, habas y alverja, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y amor, pues tiene que prevenir las inclemencias del tiempo; las que benefician o dañan sus sembríos dependiendo a la intensidad en la que se presentan, “cuando existe mucha lluvia o mucho calor perjudica la cosecha”, afirma. Paralelo a su trabajo se dedica a la venta de productos coméstibles, los cuales vende en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, donde está pensando vender gasolina a los transportistas que llegan a su localidad, donde está segura que podrá obtener buenas ganancias, ya que su localidad esta muy alejada de la ciudad principal.Este es el cuarto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe , además se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Gloria, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old. She is an outstanding single mother who cares for her two daughters, Andrea and Jimena, with great love and dedication. Gloria and her daughters have been living at her father’s house for the last three years.

For the past 10 years Gloria has been farming, growing mainly potatoes, beans, and peas. She cares for her crops with great love and attention so that they can survive inclement weather. Whether her crops thrive or sustain damage depends on the intensity of the conditions. “Whenever there is a great amount of rain or heat, the crops are at a disadvantage,” Gloria says. In addition to her farm work, she sells food products from a space set aside in her house. She plans to sell gasoline to the drivers who pass through her town. This would be a secure way of generating more income since her community is very far from the main city.

She is receiving her fourth loan with Kiva and is grateful for the financial support that she has received. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her payments. Gloria will invest 1,000 PEN in the purchase of organic fertilizer for nourishing her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio 55 años de edad soltero con hijo, originario del departamento de Chinandega ubicado al occidente del país, es propietario de una unidad de transporte de taxi vende servicios en la ciudad de Chinandega, al igual que cuenta con un camión de acarreo comercial donde tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, el inicia su negocio hace 11 años con dinero propio, el cual ha sido ahorro propio que desde muy temprana edad comenzó a trabajar, el no logro culminar sus estudios debido a que venía de una familia de pocos recursos económicos, el ahora lucha para que su hijo pueda formar un carrera profesional y ser alguien en la vida, él está solicitando financiamiento para dar mantenimientos a sus unidad de transporte al igual para la compra de llantas nuevas.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is 55 years old and single; he has one son. He is a native of the department of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. He is the owner of a taxi vehicle serving the city of Chinandega. He also has a commercial cargo truck with regular and occasional clients. 

Luis Antonio started his business eleven years ago with his own money, savings he had because he had started working at a very early age. He was unable to complete his education because he came from a family with scarce economic resources; now, he is working hard so that his son might be able to make a professional career for himself and be somebody in life. 

Luis Antonio is requesting financing to do maintenance on his vehicle as well as to buy new tires.

loans.use: to purchase new tires, lubricants, and maintenance for his commercial vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Reyneri

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que PADECOMSM le presta. Dicho préstamo le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol para este año 2013.
El crédito anterior le ha sido de mucho beneficio, ya que adquirio los insumos agricolas para la siembra anterior, de la produccion obtuvo ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos académicamente y verles crecer, que no les falte su alimentación diaria.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs more operating capital and for the good service that PADECOMSM has provided. This loan will enable him to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides for his corn and bean crops of the 2013 season.

His previous loan was of great benefit since he was able to acquire farming supplies for his crops last season. The income generated from his production helped his children academically. José could also see his children grow since they did not lack any of their daily meals.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Euridiz Yamileth

texts.es:
Euridez, se dedica a  la venta de tamales de elote. Ella vive con la familia, su esposo y sus hijos; las edades de ellos son 2 y 3 años, los tres dependen económicamente de sus ingresos. 
El negocio lo aprendió de la familia, trabaja cinco días a la semana, la ventaja con la que cuenta es la clientela que es grande y la dificultad es el transporte para  acarrear la mercadería. El préstamo lo invertirá para el alquiler de dos manzanas de tierra y poder  cultivar maíz, la produccion le servira para realizar la venta, para esta actividad su esposo ayudara con mano de obra.
Esta compra le ayudara para mejorar sus ingresos y tener mejor calidad de vida.  Su sueño es poder construir su vivienda y aumentar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Euridez, sells tamales name from sweet corn. She lives with her family, her husband and children, who are 2 and 3. The three of them depend on her income.   

She learned the business from her family. She works five days a week and the advantage is that she has a lot of customers. Her challenge is the transportation to bring her merchandise. She will invest the loan in renting two lots of land so she can plant corn. She will be able to sell the corn, and her husband will help her in this activity with the labor. 

This purchase will help her improve her income and have a better quality of life. Her dream is to be able to build her house and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay rent on two lots of land.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es: Griselda tiene 40 años de edad es originaria de una población rica en cultura e historia llamada Zitacuaro Michoacán México, ella es parte de un grupo llamado Sol, dice que ya tiene cinco años trabajando con VisionFund para poder sacar adelante su negocio de venta de ropa interior para toda la familia. Dice que empezó con su negocio a raíz de que se separo de su esposo desde hace 5 años y por no tener un trabajo estable decidió vender ropa interior, calzoncitos para niños, calcetas escolares para niña, tines para dama, caballero y niños los cuales compra en la ciudad de México ya que allá le dan precios mas bajos. Dice que vende su mercancía en pagos y al contado porque a veces la gente no tiene para pagarle todo y le van dando abonos cada semana y cada quincena y ella cada mes va a surtirse a México. Dice que le gustaría ampliar su negocio y también vender ropa para dama pero ya en un negocio estable en su casa, aunque le gusta trabajar de casa en casa vendiendo la ropa interior porque así tiene tiempo de estar al pendiente de sus tres hijos y eso la motiva salir adelante. Ella dice “gracias a que me han hecho créditos mi negocio ha crecido y eso me ha ayudado a salir adelante yo sola con mis hijos”. Las demás  integrantes del grupo se llaman Martha, Laura Angélica, Argelia, América, Karen Alejandra, Ángel Ulises y Lucia ellos invertirán en la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos para su venta, en la compra de refacciones para su venta en un taller mecánico, en la compra de ropa para su venta,  en frutas y legumbres de temporada, en la compra de refresco ya que se vende en un deposito por mayoreo y en la compra de zapato por catalogo para su venta.
texts.en:
Griselda is 40 years old. She is from a community that is rich in culture and history, called Zitacuaro in  Michoacán, México.  She is part of a group called Sol. She says that she has been working for five years with VisionFund to be able to get her business ahead. selling underwear for the whole family. She says that she started her business because she separated from her husband five years ago and she didn't have a stable job, so she decided to sell underwear, children's underwear, school stockings for girls and socks for men, women and children. She buys them in Mexico City since they have lower prices there. She says she sells her merchandise with payment plans and up front because sometimes people can't pay her everything and she gives them one week and two week payment plans. She goes to Mexico City to stock up every month. She says that she would like to expand her business and also sell women's clothing but in a stable business set up in her house, although she likes to sell the underwear door to door because she has time to care for her three children and that motivates her to get ahead. 

She says: "thank you for giving me these loans. My business has grown and that has helped me get ahead alone with my children." The other members of the group are named Martha, Laura Angélica, Argelia, América, Karen Alejandra, Ángel Ulises and Lucia. They will invest in buying ingredients to make Mexican food to sell, replacement parts to sell at a mechanics workshop, used clothes to sell, fruit and vegetables in season, beverages sold wholesale at a warehouse, and shoes via catalog to sell.

loans.use: to sell underwear for the whole family such as boxers, panties, bikinis briefs, underpants, things, boys' briefs, girls' school stockings, and socks for men, women and children.

loans.name: Flor De Canela Group

texts.es: Mariana tiene 32 años de edad, es originaria de la localidad de Curungueo y se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada. Es parte de un grupo llamado Flor de Canela, dice que  ese nombre se lo pusieron porque la casa ejidal se llama así y para que ubicaran más rápido al grupo le pusieron ese nombre. Dice que sus frutas y legumbres una parte cultiva y otra parte compra y los revende, dice que la fruta y la legumbre que ella cultiva es aguacate, cilantro, habas, frijol, nopales, rábanos, duraznos, dice que tiene con ese negocio desde hace 7 años y que lo emprendió para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus niños ya que tiene dos niños una estudia el preescolar y un pequeño de dos años. Dice que le gusta lo que hace ya que está al pendiente de sus niños ya que su terreno donde tiene sus legumbres y frutos están en el terreno de su casa platica que sale a vender a la central de abastos de Zitacuaro y en el mercado municipal. Ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para invertir en su negocio para la compra de frutas de temporada como mangos, sandias, manzanas, papayas, piñas, melones chino y verde, limones, guayabas etc. Ella dice “mi papa me enseño a trabajar y a que yo tuviera mi propio capital para que me comprara lo que yo quisiera es por eso que trabajo muy duro para comprarles a mis niños lo que ocupan”. Dice que el crédito le servirá por que mejorara su negocio y así venderá un poco más, dice que vende por bolsitas sus frutas y legumbres o por pieza si es que son grandes. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Reynaldo, Virginia y Benito ellos invertirán en la compra de insumos para hacer paletas, y nieves de diferentes sabores y también para la compra de vasos, conos, cucharitas y palitos para las paletas, también invertirán en insumos para elaborar curundas (antojitos mexicanos), y para la compra de abonos e insecticidas para cultivo de aguacate y para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada.
texts.en:
Mariana is 32 years old. She is from the community of Curungueo and she sells fruit and vegetables in season. She is a part of a group called Flor de Canela. She says that they named it that  because the community center has the same name and in order for the group to be recognized more quickly they gave it that name. She says that she grows some of her fruits and vegetables and she buys and resells the rest. The fruit and vegetables that she grows are avocados, cilantro, beans, prickly pears, radishes, and peaches. She has had this business for 7 years, because she started it to help her husband with the children's expenses. They have two children, one in preschool and another who is two. She likes what she does because she cares for her children, since the land where she has her fruit and vegetables in where her house is. She relates that she sells at the Zitacuaro market and in the city market. Right now,she is asking for a loan to invest in her business to buy fruit in season such as mangos, watermelons, papayas, pineapples, honeydew and green melons, lemons, guayabas etc. 

She says: “my father taught me to work so I would have my own capital so I could buy whatever I want. That is why I work very hard to buy my children what they need."  She says that the loan will be used to improve her business and thus sell a little more. She sells small bags of fruit and vegetables or individually if they are large. The other members of the group are named Reynaldo, Virginia and Benito. They will invest in buying materials to make popsicles and snow cones with different flavors, and also to buy cups, cones and little spoons and sticks. They will also invest in ingredients to make curundas (a Mexican appetizer) and in fertilizer and insecticide to grow avocados, and fruit and vegetables in season.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables in season to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
This is Novelyn, 42, resident of Bacoor, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Randy and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Novelyn oversees, owns and operates their Tricycle transportation business. They have one Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Novelyn hopes to have new Tricycles and dreams that her family will settle quietly and peacefully. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 44 years old. She sells sorghum. She is married with eight children aged 7 to 24 years old. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children. The previous profits helped a lot in terms of the family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a 39-year-old divorced mother of five children with whom she lives in her own home in Msambweni. The owner of a small food stall located in her home, Chizi also farms pineapples and bananas. She is very humble, hardworking, honest and responsible, and has good professional and personal references.

With hard work and sacrifice, Chizi has become successful in the business she always dreamed of having. She would now like to expand and so is requesting this loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust to increase her stock. This will enable her to gain more customers and increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sacks of potatoes and wheat flour.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is 43 years old and is a technician who graduated from Vanadzor State Technical College. As he confessed during his studies, he didn't like his chosen profession and he realized that it was not for him. After graduating, Garik started to work in sewing factories, first as a carving-worker and then as a tailor. He realized that being a tailor attracted him. Now, he works in one of the sewing factories in Vanadzor city. Garik also works also privately in his workshop, which is not far from his house, making and repairing clothing. The profit from his work enables him to sustain his family. Garik is a famous stylist in Vanadzor city and has many clients and orders. 

Garik is requesting a 350,000 AMD loan to buy textiles and other tools such as threads, buttons, needles, and other items. In the future, he dreams of creating a fashion center in Vanadzor city and of advising Vanadzor dwellers how to dress with good taste.

loans.use: to buy textiles and other tools such as threads, buttons, needles

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Yusufu from Eastern Waterloo in Sierra Leone. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 months and 15 years. Two of his children are currently attending school. In 1993, Yusufu established a local food business. He began his business because he did not go to school so he was trained in business. He works at the business from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are transportation and price inflation of goods.

Yusufu requires a loan in order to buy more ground nuts, palm oil and beans. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and increase his business. In the future, Yusufu plans to buy a plot of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ground nuts, palm oil and beans.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 23 years old and married and with one child. She has a kiosk where she sells tomatoes, mangoes, onions, vegetables, and other produce. Her store is well-known and frequented by her neighbors and other customers. Beatrice owns her house which does not have electricity or running water. 

Beatrice is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy tomatoes, onions, mangoes, vegetables and other produce to sell. She will use the profits from her loan to pay her child's school fees, which has been difficult for her.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, mangoes, vegetables and other produce to sell

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao is from Msambweni. She is married with children who all attend school. Chao runs a store from her home and she has a well-established customer base. Her husband is a businessman, and the two of them help each other to get ahead and raise their children. Chao is very hardworking and an excellent client of Yehu Microfinance. 

Chao is requesting a loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice, and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice, and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret  is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of six and 14 years old. All of her children live at home. Margret lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest number of rubber plantations in Liberia. She stopped her education after the second grade and has a business selling red oil in the local market. Margret  started her business with 5,000 LRD given to her by her sister who taught her this trade.

Margret is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil. In the future, she plans to educate all of her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 45 and lives with her husband and children. She is hardworking and sells natural soap in the center of Msambweni. Doris started her business selling a few brands of soap, and when her earnings increased, she invested and expanded her business. Her business is demanding, because she sells to her neighbors and retail shop operators. Her sales are going well.

Doris is requesting a loan to buy more herbal soaps to sell. In the future, she dreams of buying a store to keep moving ahead. Doris is happy to have the opportunity to work with Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy herbal soaps to sell

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
This is Edita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. The loan also helped in the education of her children. She has been in this business for three years now, and she has loyal customers already. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.  

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edita dreams for continuous success of her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and inventory, such as clothing, footwear, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 31 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in plantations in Liberia. She is married with 3 children between 6 to 10 years old. Three of the children live at home and are in school. For two years now she has been selling salt, vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions in the local market. She started this business by selling food in a wheel barrow and learned this trade from her friends. She spends nine hours a day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is married, and she and her partner have children who attend school. Roseline says that she has operated a motorcycle shop for years, and thanks to help from her family, she was able to get together enough capital to start her own business. Approximately three years ago she set up her repair shop to offer customers an easier, quicker repair service for their motorcycles.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more spare parts so that she can offer more variety to her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for this opportunity, as it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 46 years old and lives in Kakata the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in plantations in Liberia. She is a widow with 5 children between 16 to 21 years old. They all live at home, and her children are in school. From 1999, she has been selling fish, rice, pepper, oil etc in the local market. She started this business with her late husband and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, rice, pepper, oil etc for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, pepper, oil, etc for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 47-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari (or variety store) business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area.

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is single with one school-going child. She rents a house with neither electricity nor piped water. For the last two years, she has been doing a business of selling vegetables and fruits at the market, and she has a dream of owning a stall at the market.

With the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings that she is requesting, she will buy vegetables, bananas, mangoes and oranges to facilitate her sales and be able to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, bananas, mangoes and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Osman from Sierra Leone.  He is married with five children; the youngest is five months old.  Currently, four of his children go to school. 

Osman has a general merchandise business selling goods such as baby clothing, oil, baby powder, and Vaseline.  He started his business 12 years ago, and works at his business eleven hours each day, seven days a week throughout the month. 

He request this loan to buy more inventory such as onions, flasks, baby powder, and Vaseline.  He hopes to one day open a big enterprise to sell all types of baby clothing, and to open another branch in the country.  He cites transportation and storage as his greatest challenges.  

He is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as onions, flasks, baby powder, and Vaseline.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Please meet 38 year old Sabina from Sierra Leone.  She is married with 2 children, the youngest is 6 years old; both children are in school.  She is also caring for three relatives.

Sabina has been selling drinks, coal, biscuits, palm oil, and other miscellaneous products from her home since 1994.  She works at her business from 7am to 11pm, 7 days a week.  

She requests this loan from BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more items for her business, including biscuits, palm oil, and coal.  

She wants her children to be educated, and to take her business to an international level.  She says that transportation and lack of reliable electricity to keep her drinks cool are her two main challenges.  

She will use the extra income generated from the loan to pay school fees.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items for her business including biscuits, palm oil, and coal.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 37 years old and lives in Kakata the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in plantations in Liberia. She is single with 5 children between 12 to 17 years old. She was unfortunate. For 10 years now she has been selling local palm oil in the local market. She started this business with her mother and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer is a 44-year-old tailor. He resides in the Dansoman community. He has been in this business for the past 4 years and doing very well.  He is a very dedicated individual and hardworking. 

He joined ID Ghana in August, 2011, through another beneficiary. He has since taken 3 loans from ID. He is applying for his 4th loan and needs GHS 1,300 to buy more materials to sew and sell to his customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sew and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 30 years old; she lives in Msambweni. She is divorced, but has been able to raise three children on her own. 

Virginia has a well-stocked store; farming also provides her another other source of income. She is a hardworking and responsible person who is getting ahead with her hard work. Thanks to her work, she has given her children what they need to have a dignified life without deprivation.

She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, baked goods, and more. 

She says that her goal is to be able to keep growing her business and gaining customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, baked goods, and more to sell.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a 31-year-old seller of food stuffs, such as cassava, plantain, vegetables and fish. She resides in the Dansoman community. She has been in this business for the past year and still doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business.
 
This is her 1st loan and she needs an amount of GHS 350 to expand her business and buy more goods to enable her to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs (cassava, plantain, vegetables, fish) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 37 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has a plantation with the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is married with three children between 13 and 22 years old, only one of whom lives at home. All of them attend school. 

For two years now she has been selling salt, vita water, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions in the local market. She started this business, which was given to her by her mother, and learned this trade from her friends. She spends nine hours a day on her business. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase more vita water, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more vita water, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Deisy Paola

texts.es:
Deisy es una representación de lo que es posible lograrse con el empeño y el esfuerzo, con tan solo 19 años de edad, ha logrado emprender camino en el mundo de los negocios. Gracias a la colaboración de sus padres esta joven subarrendó un local de un tío y comenzó con la elaboración de productos de panadería, actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar. Desde hace seis meses abrió su negocio al público y gracias a la buena acogida ha fidelizado a un gran número de clientes del sector.
Con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio, Deisy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un horno y una vitrina, con el fin de que sus productos tengan una mayor vida útil. Espera que con esta inversión su negocio siga creciendo y pueda ahorrar el dinero necesario para ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Deisy is an example of what it is possible to achieve with determination and effort.  She is only 19 years old, and she has managed to start moving in the world of business.  

Thanks to her parents’ collaboration, this young woman sublet a place from her uncle.  She started making baked goods.  She learned this business activity as a family tradition.  Six months ago she opened her business to the public.  Thanks to the good reception, she has gained a great number of loyal customers in her area.

Deisy is requesting a loan in order to improve the quality of her service.  She will buy an oven and a display case.  She will do this so that her products stay fresh longer.  With this investment she hopes that her business will continue growing.  She also hopes to be able to save the money needed to attend the university.

loans.use: to buy an oven and a display case.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. Maribel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, soap and detergents, sodas, rice and food seasonings. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Maribel dreams of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soap and detergents, sodas, rice and food seasonings.

loans.name: Dince

texts.en:
Dince is a 48-year-old woman and married to Christofel, 51 years old. They have been blessed with 3 children. 2 of them are married and the last one, Yeni, 16 years old, is a Junior High School student.

Dince has been running a kerosene business since 1990. She sells 400 liters of kerosene per week. Due to the fact that most people are still using kerosene to cook, the product can be quickly sold. This enables her to generate an income of about IDR 240,000 per week. 

At the moment, she plans to buy 100 more liters but she does not have the money to do so. She got information that TLM usually assists a small entrepreneur to improve their business. She then requested a loan of IDR 8,000,000 from TLM. She is sure the loan assistance provided by TLM will help her in improving her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy 100 more liters of kerosene.

loans.name: Gbassah

texts.en:
Gbassah is 37 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is married with three children between 5 and 20 years old; they all live at home, and her children are in school.

For three years now, she has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls, etc.) for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Adam.  He is married and has two children, aged 8 and 2 years. In 2000, Adam  established his stationery business. He began his business as a means of generating revenue. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 750,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy more stationery. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. In the future, Adam plans to open an outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stationery.

loans.name: Vartenik

texts.en:
Vartenik lives in Yerevan with her mother and daughter, Lusine (in the photo), who is 19 years old. Lusine studies at the Armenian State Police Academy in the faculty of jurisprudence. She works hard to study well and dreams to become a good specialist.

Vartenik is a teacher in a local school, but unfortunately, her teaching salary is not enough for covering the family's costs and at the same time, saving money for Lusine's education.

The loan will help Vartenik to cover her daughter's university tuition. It is very important for Lusine to complete her education and find a job, which will help her to ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín es un campesino de 33 años de edad, ama el campo y asegura que su mayor felicidad es poder compartir y disfrutar de la naturaleza. Desde niño aprendió de la agricultura y la ganadería, por lo cual aprovechó sus conocimientos para crear su propio negocio. Hoy se dedica a la ganadería y la comercialización de leche. 
Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y a sus dos hijos menores de edad garantizarles una buena educación. 
Con el fin de cumplir sus deseos Efraín se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca productora de leche, con la que espera generar mayores ingresos y solventar las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Efraín, age 33, is a farmer.  He loves the land, and he affirms that his greatest happiness is being able to share and enjoy nature.  He learned about agriculture and livestock when he was a boy.  He took advantage of this knowledge in order to create his own business.  He now raises livestock and sells the milk.

His biggest dream is to be able to give his family a better quality of life and ensuring that his two minor children get a good education.

In order to realize his wishes, Efraín is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow.  By doing so he hopes to generate greater income and to pay for the household necessities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Bendu is a widow with six children between the ages of 12 and 26 years old. Only four of them are attending school and live at home. Bendu did not attend grade school but she was able to attend a vocational school where she learned how to manage her business and her home. 

For the past three years she has been selling palm oil in her community and at the market. She spends 9 hours a day with her business. She started this business with money given to her by her brother and learned this way of selling from her friends. Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the near future she would like to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 36 years old. She lives in the Borjomi District with her 43-year-old husband, Jumber, and three children who are going to school. Irma requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the mini-bus that they own. Jumber gets private orders and he transports different things.

Irma requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Irma will purchase potatoes at the wholesale price from Akhalkalaki district, bring it to Borjomi and sell it with a price markup among their villagers. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to trade with potatoes.

loans.name: Saribek

texts.en:
Saribek is 44 years old and lives in Sevan city with his wife. He has three daughters who are married and live separately from their parents with their new families. 

Saribek graduated only secondary school and has no specialization, as after serving in the Soviet army, he married and didn't have the ability to study in University. He started to work as a foreman in a bread factory in order to sustain his newly created family. Saribek has dreamed to become an economist. 

He worked as a foreman until 2002, when he decided to create his own business. He launched a food-trading business in the food market of Sevan city. This activity brought him more profit, and his family income increased and enabled him to buy a small shop. In 2007, he started to do his food-trading business in his own shop. He sells dairy products, bread, meat, oil, some non-alcoholic drinks, candies, etc.
 
Today, Saribek is very pleased with his life. He confessed that though he didn't become an economist, he has three wonderful children, which are his great pride and gift in life.

Saribek needs a 500,000 Armenian Drams loan to increase his food assortment by buying food for reselling in his shop, which will help him to receive a good profit and to enlarge his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food for reselling in his shop.

loans.name: Cythina

texts.en:
Cythina is 42 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is married with four children between 4 and 27 years old; only one lives at home and is in school. She was unfortunately unable to attend school.

She has been involved in business for the past 15 years, and presently, she is selling flour, salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomatoes in the local market. She started this business with 2,000 LD (Liberian dollars) given to her by her husband, and learned this trade from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomatoes for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomatoes for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 29 years old and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Ruth is single and has three children aged 4, 6 and 8. Her children are attending school and they all live at home. For the past 4 years she has been operating a shop where she sells palm oil. Sometimes she has few customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the future she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Elmis

texts.es:
Elmis de 43 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora que desea sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos, con el fin de brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida. Desde joven aprendió el oficio de la confección y se ha dedicado a esta actividad como fuente de empleo para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Asegura que las cosas no han sido fáciles y cuando el trabajo escasea debe recurrir en búsqueda  de nuevas fuentes de ingresos, por lo cual en ocasiones realiza labores domésticas en casa de sus vecinos.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando de un crédito con el objeto de invertir en la compra de insumos como telas, botones e hilos, para reactivar sus labores y dedicarse a la confección directa, lo que le permitirá generar ingresos constantes para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmis is 43 years old. She is a determined woman who wants to get ahead with her four children, with the goal of giving them better opportunities in life. Starting when she was young, she learned the profession of tailoring, and she has dedicated herself to this activity as a source of employment to support her household. 

She reports that things have not been easy, and when work is scarce she has to resort to looking for new sources of income. Thus, she occasionally does domestic work in her neighbors' house. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan with the goal of investing in supplies such as fabrics, buttons and thread, in order to resume her work and dedicate herself to tailoring directly for customers. This will permit her to generate a steady stream of income to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fabrics, buttons and thread).

loans.name: Fanny Ester

texts.es:
Fanny a sus 28 años de edad, es una gran visionaria con millares de sueños que desea hacer realidad. Gracias a la oportunidad que le brindó su tío para que sembrara papa en un lote de su propiedad, esta mujer se ha convertido en una microempresaria.
Fanny siente que este negocio es una gran oportunidad para aprender del campo y mejorar su condición económica.
Su mayor sueño siempre ha sido estudiar medicina, pero cuenta que su familia nunca tuvo los recursos económicos para que ingresara a la universidad, por lo cual laboró en diferentes oficios a fin de ahorrar y pagarse su carrera. Hoy está convencida que con su propio negocio su sueño comenzará a materializarse, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de abonos con el fin  de sacar una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos y cumplir su gran deseo al convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Fanny, at 28 years old, is a great visionary with thousands of dreams she wants to make come true. Thanks to the opportunity given to her by her uncle, which meant she could sow potatoes on a plot on her uncle's property, this woman has become a micro-businesswoman. Fanny feels that this business is a great opportunity to learn from the fields and improve her economic situation.

Her biggest dream has always been to study medicine, but since her family could never afford to send her to university, she has worked in different professions in order to save money to put towards her career. Today she is convinced that with her own business her dream will start to become true, which is why she is asking for this loan. She will invest it in buying fertilizer with the aim of reaping a good harvest, which will allow her to increase her income and realise her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Hawa.  She is married and has one child who is 12.

In 2010, Hawa established her textiles business. She began her business after her husband gave her money to be used for domestic purposes.  But, she diverted it to a business, which was appreciated by her husband; he even decided to encourage her more. 

Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000, so she can buy 50 suits of Africana dress @ Le 100,000. 

She hopes this loan will increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Hawa plans to become an international business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 50 suits of Africana dress @ Le 100,000.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more plantains to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lice

texts.es: Lice, de 47 años de edad, esta casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 22 años quien es una mujer profesional gracias al apoyo constante e incondicional que le brindaron sus padres.Lice tiene dos actividades laborales , el primero consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi ya que tiene un vehículo que pudo obtener gracias a sus ahorros y cuenta con un chofer experimentado que diariamente acude a su casa para recibir el vehículo en el que trabaja por las calles de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad más de 04 años y le va muy bien por que tiene un ingreso fijo diario el cual le ayuda a sobrellevar los gastos básicos de su hogar .Su segunda actividad es la venta de ropa , actividad que realiza desde hace 03 años con la ayuda de su hija.Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que puede organizar su tiempo y disponer de sus ratos libres como lo considere, afirma que de esta forma cumple su rol de madre y mujer de manera óptima ya que se siente una mujer capaz e independiente. Espera continuar trabajando y desarrollando sus funciones sin ningun problema. Su gran deseo es establecer un negocio formal y de mayor productividad en su propia casa orientada al sector alimenticio.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva. Es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles pondrá a su vehiculo en mantenimiento y comprará ropa para niños y adultos .
texts.en:
Lice, 47 years old, is married and lives in her own home along with her husband and her 22-year-old daughter, who is a professional woman thanks to the constant and unconditional support provided by her parents.

Lice has two jobs. The first consists of renting out a motorcycle taxi, since she has a vehicle that she was able to obtain thanks to her savings, and she has an experienced driver that comes to her home every day to pick up the vehicle with which he works on the streets of the city. She has worked like this for more than four years and it is going very well for her because she has a daily fixed income which helps her to bear the basic expenses of her home. Her second job is the sale of clothing, an activity that she has performed for three years with the help of her daughter. What she liked about this job is that she can organize her time and spend her free time as she wants. She affirms that in this way she performs her role of mother and wife in an optimal way since she feels like she is a capable and independent woman. She hopes to continue working and developing her skills without any problem.
 
Her greatest wish is to establish a formal and high-productivity business in her own home in the food industry. This is loan number 4 with Kiva. It is because of this that she thanks those who make possible this funding that will help her to complete her objectives. With the amount requested of 1000 Soles, she will maintain her vehicle and buy clothing for children and adults.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle and buy clothing.

loans.name: Marlene Maria

texts.es: Marlene desde hace 2 años inició un negoco de alimentos, que adquirió de su tio: inicialmente vendia comidas ráidas y paso a pasó agregó el servicio de restaurante con diversos menus. Sus ventas las realiza en el centro de la ciudad donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio y vende diariamente durante 10 horas. Su meta es lograr fortalecerlos con un menaje de cocina completo que facilite el trabajo y atraiga cada vez a amas clientes, por la efectivida de su servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financimeinto que hace alña Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará frituras para la venta, mesas, sillas, pues requiere hacer del lugar de servicios un espacio agradable y cómodo, para generar  mas ingresos y que sus tres hijos  en las edades de 14 a 17 años tengan un mayo bienestar y con ello una vida mas exitosa.
texts.en:
2 years ago, Marlene started up a food business, which she acquired from her uncle: initially she sold fast food and step by step she added the restaurant service with various menus. Her sales are made in the centre of the city where her business is located and she is open 10 hours a day.

Her goal is to strengthen her sales with a fully furnished kitchen which would facilitate work and bring in more and more clients, due to the efficacy of her service. At present she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first she has taken, with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy fried foods for sale, tables and chairs, and then she needs to turn the dining area into a comfortable and pleasant space, to generate more income and so she can improve the well-being of her three children between the ages of 14 and 17 and with it, a more successful life.

loans.use: to buy fried foods to sell, and tables and chairs.

loans.name: Jonny Enrique

texts.es:
Jonny de 42 años de edad, se dedica desde  hace quince años a la comercialización de artículos diversos como calzado, productos de belleza y hogar. Actividad que es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijas menores de edad.
Con el propósito de mejorar su situación económica e ingresar a su hija mayor a la universidad, Jonny se encuentra solicitando un crédito que le permita adquirir mayor volumen de mercancía con el fin de abrir nuevos nichos de mercado dentro de la región y generar mayores ingresos.
Sueña con  brindarle a su familia una vida digna alejada de las necesidades que han padecido a causa de su inestabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Jonny is 42 years old, and for the past fifteen years, has made a living selling a range of items such as shoes, beauty products and household goods. This is his only source of income to support his family, comprising his wife and his two young children.

With the aim of improving his financial situation and sending his oldest daughter to university, Jonny is requesting a loan which will enable him to buy more merchandize to explore new markets in the area and boost his profits. His dream is to provide his family with a dignified life, and prevent them from going without due to his job instability.

loans.use: to buy shoes, beauty products and household goods.

loans.name: Laura Eugenia

texts.es:
Laura de 49 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de productos de panadería (pasteles, hojaldres de pollo y atún con verduras, panes y pandequesos). Diariamente realiza su producción a primera hora de la mañana y sale a venderlos en las calles de su localidad puerta a puerta. Gracias al buen servicio y a  al calidad de su productos ha logrado fidelizar un alto número de clientes que le solicitan encargos para sus eventos y fechas especiales. 
Laura aprendió la actividad, gracias a un curso gratuito que realizó en un instituto de formación para el trabajo y el desarrollo humano y con su práctica ha perfeccionado el oficio. 
Su mayor deseo es poder materializar su idea de negocio y colocar una panadería, para la generación de mayores ingresos. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima e insumos. Espera que con las utilidades generadas pueda garantizarle a sus dos hijas mejores oportunidades educativas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
Laura is 49 years old. She works in the making of bakery products (cakes, puff pastries made of chicken and tuna with vegetables, breads, and cheese breads). She produces her goods daily in the first hours of the morning and goes out to sell them on the streets of her town door to door. Thanks to her good service and the quality of her products, she has been able to foster loyalty in a large number of customer that request orders for their events and special occasions. 

Laura learned this activity thanks to a free course that she attended in an institute for work education and human development, and with practice has perfected the craft.

Her greatest wish is to be able to materialize her business idea and open a bakery to generate a better income. The reason for which she is requesting a loan is to invest in the purchase of raw materials and supplies. She hopes that with the help generated she is able to guarantee her two daughters better educational opportunities and a better quality of life in her home.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies (flour, sugar, chicken, tuna).

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer living in the Coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. He is married and has three children. For the last ten years, Peter has been a crop farmer, planting cassava and cereals. He was introduced to Milango by his friends.

Peter is requesting a 21,000 KES loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He is also not hesitant about investing in beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is married and the father of three daughters. His daughter Nushik studies at Yerevan State University in the faculty of journalism. Samvel is from the Syuniq region, which is famous for its severe cold climate. The best local agricultural businesses are cattle farming and limited land cultivation. Samvel breeds cattle and is a farmer. His farm business is his only source of income. Unfortunately, it is very difficult for Samvel to save money for his daughter's education. 

Samvel is requesting a loan to pay university tuition for his daughter. His loan will give her an opportunity to complete her education and become a good journalist.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for his daughter

loans.name: Héctor Emilio

texts.es:
Héctor de 60 años de edad, se encuentra radicado en la ciudad de Medellín en donde labora diariamente de diez de la mañana a doce de la noche en una salsamentaría, que ha creado con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación. Gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos.
Su mayor sueño es garantizarle a su familia condiciones de vida digna y velar por el crecimiento y la permanencia en el mercado de su negocio, ya que está convencido que éste será el legado que le entregará a sus hijos y estos a su nietos.
Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones higiénicas y de salubridad de su negocio, Héctor se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en adecuaciones locativas para prestar un mejor servicio y la compra de surtido para contar con un stock de inventario.
texts.en:
Héctor, 60 years old,  lives in the city of Medellín, where he works daily from 10 am - 12 am in a delicatessen, which he set up with a lot of effort and dedication. Thanks to this work he has managed to get his family ahead, made up of his wife and two children.
